Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness for the Chandler Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Gigis_mum
Reviews.Content: I'M SO GLAD I FOUND YOU ON TA! I've been wanting to take my 13yo to Boston for years but hotel prices are always high. Then, I noticed the $99 special for the Chandler Inn on TA Boston Hotels. It seemed at first like an inconvenient location (most people stay downtown, near the water, in Back Bay or Copley Square) but using Google maps, I found that it's only 2 blocks from the Back Bay station and there's a bus stop right around the corner. Little did I know how lucky we were... We arrived at 2pm and were warmly greeted by Gretchen Chauncey. I didn't realize that she was the General Manager. I noticed the TA certificate proudly displayed on the check-in counter and asked her if she would like a TA decal for the front window (she said, 'Yes, please!'). Although we were early, our room was ready for us and Gretchen noted that I had requested a higher floor (to avoid noise from the bar downstairs). The room was a bit small but very clean, with a nice bathroom and comfy beds. For that price, I think it was a great deal. As soon as we had dropped our bags, we headed out to Tremont Street for lunch. It's only 3-4 blocks away. What a great area for shopping and dining! Over the course of our 3-day visit, we ate at B&G Oyster Bar, Sibling Rivalry and the South End Buttery. It was so easy to walk to the restaurants and back. Having a 7-11 convenience around the corner was very nice too. While we were in town, an electric company transformer caught on fire and caused a widespread blackout in Back Bay. We were riding the metro at the time when we heard the news. Exiting the Back Bay metro station, the streets were pitch black. Residents were standing out on the street, talking about the power outage and sharing flashlights. We didn't realize how serious it was at the time. We made our way towards the hotel in the dark, using the dim light from my iPhone. Half a block away, like a beacon in the night (sorry for the cliche), Chandler Inn's lights were particularly bright! Lucky us -- the hotel was on a different electric grid and it had power. A whole 2 days later, I learned that the guests in the big and expensive Back Bay hotels had had to evacuate. No electricity and no hot water. I'm sure glad we were at the Chandler Inn. It felt like a home away from home. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful, like family.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Cannot Beat The Price!”
Reviews.Author: patraveler38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Chander Inn for a long weekend recently. The front desk staff was very nice and happy to help. They were always up for a little chat when we came in late at night as well. :) The inn is easy to get to from the metro and within walking distance of nearly anything you might want to see during your stay (although we did take the T a couple of times). The theater district is only a few blocks away and we had a plenty of wonderful restaurants to choose from for dinner each night. The neighborhood feels very safe, even at night and is clean and well kept. The rooms are small, but sufficient for the needs of a couple. They would most likely be too small for anyone traveling with children. The walls were a little thin, so there was a good bit of noise from the hallway mostly, as well as little from neighboring rooms. We were on the top floor, so I can't say if the noise from upper rooms would be intrusive. Overall, a wonderful place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: rarSeattle
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chandler Inn numerous times. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Back Bay station. I experienced a pleasant check in experience. The staff was friendly offering a map of the area and greeting me throughout my stay. I wish the restaurant located in the hotel was open for breakfast during the week. The rooms while not large were updated and clean. Mine did not have a closet to hang clothes but I didn't mind. The bathroom had a walk in shower and quality tolietries were provided. I give the hotel 5 stars in every category.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: 159SRJ
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent just minutes away from great restaurants in Tremont St Try Mela for great Indian food and service. Also there is an Ethiopian restaurant (Addis- Red Sea) that is a very different dining experience Staff were very helpful and friendly and gave us any advice that we asked for The rooms are a little small but "Funky"! All in all a fabulous experience at a good price by Boston standards

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel just slightly off centre.”
Reviews.Author: strakur74
Reviews.Content: Not too far from the Back Bay Amtrak and Orange Line station. Be sure to exit from the Clarendon St. end of the station, saving you five minutes' walk. The hotel is very basic with no in-house dining facilities. But tea/coffee is complementary and ice is available from a machine at the ground floor. Unfortunately the few restaurants that are within 10 minutes' walk are not very good/inviting. The room is small but OK if you are not staying in that much. You cannot really use this as a base to work. Bathroom is recently refurbished. Cleaning is OK. The hotel was classified as a two-star one at booking.com but probably is worth three stars; but for the standard that it offers it is not a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: NOLAlaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chandler Inn in September 2011. Like many other reviews here the rooms are not large but quite enough room for two people who weren't spending a lot of time in their hotel. The front desk staff were super friendly, offering suggestions for local restaurants, directions, parking options. Very clean and in close walking distance to some great restaurants. The sports bar next door was nice, friendly staff and great drinks at good prices. Definitely a place I would stay again (and will in May!)

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel in the back bay area”
Reviews.Author: Sosuma
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but stylish. Not suitable for more than one person unless you like being in a confined space. Service was adequate. A little bit too much attitude from the front desk clerk but suspect they aren't aware how they come across to guests who actually expect a friendly welcome at a hotel. Overall adequate hotel in reasonable location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Anna T
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and price. The rooms were decorated very nicely and were very clean (although the bathrooms are tiny!). We also liked the coffee machine in the foyer. Our only disappointment was the noise from the main road, we had thought that it would be quiet because of the side streets but unfortunately the hotel is on a busy crossroads. But other than that, a great place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for a weekend on the town.”
Reviews.Author: Emster802
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect size room for us when we didn't really spend a lot of time there, out sightseeing in the city. Friendly, out-of-the-way staff. Only complaints were that the water smelled a little funny (old pipes?) and the big shower didn't slope to the drain quite right, left standing water. Otherwise, it was convenient and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel in the heart of Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: Mircyn
Reviews.Content: We were referred to this hotel by friends as it was very close to where we needed to be for this trip (Boston Ballet). The room was tiny and the bathroom even tinier, but it was all decorated with a lot of panache. Desk staff could not have been kinder or more helpful. A nice coffee shop was literally around the corner for morning coffee and breakfast, and it was a very short walk to where we needed to be. We had read on prior ratings on TA that noise could be a factor and had asked for as quiet a room as possible and were put on the top (eighth) floor. Someone in the room next to us was a bit loud on a couple of occasions, but otherwise were very quiet. Definitely a good price too for that area of the city. Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel and so much better than in the past!”
Reviews.Author: Cosmos_Estrela
Reviews.Content: 8-9 years ago I stayed in the Chandler Inn and at that time it definitely was a low budget hotel. Now that they renovated all floors this hotel is a little gem in the city of Boston. Yes, the rooms are not that big, but they are really nicely designed with a lot of attention to detail. And although the location is on the Â´other sideÂ´ of the highway everything is really within walking distance. It is a short walk to Copley Square and Boston Common and from there the rest of the city is within reach. Also, its location in the South End means you are able to explore this cosy neighborhood with its independent store and nice bars and cafes. I would definitely advise anyone to stay here and to stay away from the bigger hotel chains that seem to be everywhere in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Charming stay at the Chandler Inn”
Reviews.Author: CPtini
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the charming Chanlder Inn (2/4/12 - 2/5/12). It is charming in the sense that the front desk staff were so genuinely friendly and welcoming. And it is cozy because the rooms (and especially the bathroom) are small but the decor is modern, fun, and different!!! We felt very comfortable there with no judgement whatsoever and none of those double-back looks you can get at other STRAIGHT hotels/inns even in the liberal city of Boston. Definitely will return and recommend the Chandler Inn! Highly recommend for a comfortable, affordable, and safe play to stay in the South end!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location, Small Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: andylipp
Reviews.Content: I checked in for a two-night stay while attending a weekend event in the South End. I had high hopes bu, sadly, checked out after one night. On the upside, the staff was excellent, accommodating me in every way prior to and during my stay. The rooms are very small; the bathroom laughably so, but that really was not an issue. The shower (no tub) was spacious enough with adequate water pressure and plenty of hot water. The small space was very clean and seemingly well maintained. All this being said, I checked out before the second night because I slept so poorly on the first night of my stay. There was too much way noise from the inside of the adjoining guest room-talking and television sound poured through the wall until 5 AM. Add to that the sound of loud plumbing and slamming doors from down the hallway and I barely got a couple of hours of shut-eye. Note that the sounds of the city outside the hotel were quite tolerable up on the 7th floor, but noise from inside was unbearable.Granted, I'm a pretty light sleeper, but be forewarned. Too bad, because the hotel itself and people running it were really great, as is the South End location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Manuel B
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at the Chandler Inn. What a lovely hotel. Beautifully decorated. Great location. All the places i wanted to see were within walking distance. The staff was super friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. As some of you have pointed out, the rooms are a bit small. Not a big deal. We had an amazing time, thank you guys!.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ladybird2007
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel. Good location. Quiet and safe neighborhood. We hear a little bit the noise in the other rooms. We enjoyed our stay ! Staff is very nice !

Reviews.Title: “The Chandler Inn, Boston MA”
Reviews.Author: caftravel
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights in Boston at the Chandler Inn. What a great find-- although it wasn't elegant-- it was certainly quite satisfactory and it did not strain my budget. The Inn is near the Back Bay and Beacon Hill areas and has wonderful little coffee shops in the immediate neighborhood. It is a no-frills place but our room was clean and satisfactory. I believe it cost $99 per night and with the AAA rate we got it down to something like $89 per night plus tax. A clean hotel in a good neighborhood in Boston was an excellent fine-- that left us plenty of cash to spend in some of Boston's really nice restaurants. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice quality apartments with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: picklepattie
Reviews.Content: Clean and stylish, this accommodation is in walking distance from the main rail station. Staff were very friendly and only too happy to help with our requests. The rooms may be small by some standards but are well designed with everything you could need for a comfortable stay. Would definitely book here again and will recommend to any friends looking for Boston accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Elien E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chandler inn with my brother during the winter break. It is a good location, everything is dual walking or you can take the metro which is nearby. It was quiet and clean. We had a room with two twin beds. It was quite small but it contained everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, you can't beat this”
Reviews.Author: voyage_a_varadero
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel over a month a go, 2 weeks before the trip I noticed a special price on their website. I requested a change on my reservation to reflect the now lower price, it was done in less then 24 hours. At that price I even added a second night to my trip....so glad I did. Asked for a high floor,quiet room...got floor 6 ( out of 8 ) and a room with an other room on only one side ( very quiet ). So far everything looked good. Got in the room ( boutique queen ), small but not too small, deco reflected the "boutique" theme, very nice, my girlfriend loved everything about it. Clean, smelled fresh, window opens ( love to hear the beat of the city ). Is it a 5 star...no, but everything about it was great ( check in = 2 minutes, check out = 1 minutes ) staff was pleasant. I WILL go back to Boston at this particular hotel. You are 15 minutes walk to Prudential center ( shopping mall ), to chinatown, you are 20 minutes walk to Boston common and theater district, you are 25 minutes walk to Fenway park. Loved everything about it. Cant wait to go back. **** only complaint, even on the 6th floor we could hear the street noise and people talking lound on street level from the window , it did close well but you could hear the outside easily ****

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Ship-Shape!”
Reviews.Author: ExecAssistantMN_2
Reviews.Content: Travelers say the best trips are those where you feel like a part of the local people. Staying at the Chandler Inn Hotel was staying in the local neighborhood. The old-fashion, beautiful Boston townhomes are on the same street as the hotel. Around the corner is the neighborhood coffee spot - Berkley Perks. Down the street is the construction workers favorite breakast spot - Billy's. Two blocks away is the local subway station that will whisk you all over Boston for $2! The front desk at the hotel is very friendly and kind. They watched our bags for the day after we checked out and toured the downtown area. The hotel rooms may be smaller but the provisions are everything you need to make your Boston visit great. The beds are extremely firm. The place made me think of our sailboat where everything is on a smaller scale and there is a place for everything. I recommend it highly for those travelers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chandler Inn with my daughter during her winter break and found it an ideal choice, especially for travelers on a budget. The room was, while not huge, nicely appointed with everything we needed, attractive, clean and comfortable. We had a small problem with the bathroom that was repaired promptly -- and they took off the surcharge for the refrigerator to apologize for the inconvenience. The Chandler Inn is extremely well-located -- a couple of blocks form both Amtrak and T stations, in a pretty, residential neighborhood. We will stay there again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very design place”
Reviews.Author: Leonard_Genie
Reviews.Content: really downtown Nice room, very design and clean. we get the room for 145$/ night tax included. I think it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: newtonmatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as a quick city getaway. For $100 a night (winter rate) it's a great place to stay. Nothing fancy but the rooms are clean (but small) and the staff excellent. We like it because of the location. Its just of Tremont street in the South End which is home to a dozen or more great restaurants and bars. You can choose from Sibling Rivalry, Hamersely's, Aquitane,, Stephi's on Tremont, B&G Oyster, 28 Degreeees, Metropolis and may more. We ate at Metropolis which was just Okay, but had brunch at Stephi's which was great. 28 degrees was a "hip" place but expensive: a martini and beer cost us $24 with tip. Copley place is also a short walk away. If you are from out of town you can take a commuter line (look up schedules under MBTA on web from the west (Needham or Framingham Line). You can get off at back bay station and walk. It's only a few blocks. Just know that trains don't run on Sunday's though. That way you can miss traffic and don't have to worry about parking which is scarce. Also if you have to catch a morning flight, the hotel is just a few minutes from Logan airport. On ramp to 93 north is just a few blocks away and from there its 10 minutes to Logan. Stay here and have a good dinner instead of staying at one of the airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Boston Bargain”
Reviews.Author: CTSansan
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful New Year's weekend at the Chandler Inn...at a fraction of the cost of surrounding hotels. Located within walking distance of downtown Boston, on a relatively quiet street, the Chandler was a lucky find. Our room, though small by some standards, had everything we needed, and was immaculately clean. We try to "be green," so we appreciated the minimalist style of the accommodations, without sacrificing comfort. The bed was super-comfortable and the large flat screen TV was great for catching up on the Bowl Games! The staff was friendly, professional and helpful, helping us find an open store on New Year's Eve when we realized that my husband had forgotten his dress shirt. Highly recommended for a convenient, inexpensive, and minimalist experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for Boston”
Reviews.Author: aridley21
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over the new year and found the hotel to be very comfortable and in a good location, the only time we took the subway was to the airport as the hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Boston Common. Compared to the price of some of the more central hotels this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_AAustralia
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the chandler inn, I stayed with my partner for 5 nights we had a room on the 8th floor and we couldn't be happier. All the staff we encountered we're fantastic they were more than willing to help us with anything whether it be directions on where to go or what to do around Boston. The room was very nice, flat screen tv with plenty of channels to choose from, comfortable bed and cosy little bathroom. The location of chandler inn was fantastic it was so easy to get around it was a short distance to the train station to catch a short train ride to TD gardens to watch an ice hockey or basketball game. The chandler inn is within Walking distance to the main part of town where you can do the freedom trail and a number of other things. As we were there in winter the old town trolly tour cost us each 36 dollars but we got unlimited use of the trolley for 7 days! And we were able to purchase the tickets for this from the chandler inn which is just so convienient! There is a bar attached to the inn incase you would like to go for a drink which is great and if your feeling a little hungry or thirsty there is a 24 hr 7/11 just around the corner! Also to a lady who worked on reception who recommended Emilio's ( which we were able to get delivered to our room) we loved it and had it twice for dinner! On my next trip to Boston I will be staying at the chandler inn and reccomending it to all my family and friends :D

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Well Priced”
Reviews.Author: JenelleKappe
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel - especially for the price point. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never had a hotel experience this bad - 4 stars is not right.”
Reviews.Author: bostontraveler294
Reviews.Content: Worst experience I've ever had in a hotel, and their 4 stars on TripAdvisor is completely bogus. Here's why: 1. Totally irritating and long check-in process and smallest lobby ever built 2. Stains on the runner, hair in sheets and the whole bed looked skeevy. 3. Other guests were having all kinds of other issues - malfunctioning room keys, messed-up room booking, long waits, etc. We decided this wasn't worth the $115 for the night and asked to leave. The one saving grace of the Chandler was that they let us free without charge after we explained our issues.

Reviews.Title: “Unique boutique hotel, affordable price, great location”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoShadyLady
Reviews.Content: The Chandler Inn is a small, stylish hotel in the South End right off "restaurant row" (Tremont Street). We really enjoyed our stay there! And it is a surprisingly good deal! Probably the higher your room, the better, considering street noise. We were on the 9th floor and it was not a problem. There is no restaurant or room service, although there is a sports bar attached to the hotel. As you are a hop, skip and a jump away from "restaurant row," why would you want to eat at the hotel anyway?! There is a fancy coffee machine in the lobby where you can make cappuccino, hot chocolate, etc. The rooms are small (you are in downtown Boston, after all), but it was all the space we needed. The bathroom is very compact also. The bed was very comfortable, and the furnishings are modern and pleasant. There is no safe in the room (one thing that would've been nice... not that we had any problems). The front desk was friendly and helpful. We ate breakfast every morning at Francesca's Cafe (short walk away on Tremont). It was GREAT! In addition to plenty of yummy and healthy breakfast / lunch options, they have lots of specialty coffees and hot chocolates served in giant cups (practically bowls)! Not to be missed if you like that kind of thing! The service is good too. We really enjoyed the Metropolis Cafe for dinner. It is a cozy wine bar with great ambiance. We didn't have a reservation but a kind hostess found us a seat at the bar. This was actually great. We had a view of the restaurant, and the bartenders are attentive without being intrusive. Great wine selection and delicious food. We tried B&G Oysters one night and found it overrated and very expensive. It wasn't bad but it didn't live up to the hype or the price tag. The host and our server were very helpful though. I found people in Boston to be very nice! We walked the Freedom Trail, took the Duck Tour, and shopped on Newbury Street, all of which are within walking distance of the hotel. Very convenient not to need a car in downtown Boston + didn't have to worry about parking, either at the hotel or when out and about. Honestly, I was a little disappointed in the Freedom Trail and the Duck Tour... maybe the cold, gloomy weather had something to do with this. Newbury Street is very nice though, with lots of shops and cafes with outside seating. Anyway, if I am ever in Boston again, I will happily stay at the Chandler Inn again! It is so nice, convenient and affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great stay at the Chandler Inn”
Reviews.Author: Reggie S
Reviews.Content: I had Great service and the best recommendations at the Chandler Inn while I was in Boston last weekend. I arrived a little early and they were able to accommodate and no waiting! It appeared that the room was remodeled from last time I was there to my surprize. The bed was comfrotable and it was nice and quiet. Great location for the South End and easy intstruction to actually take the "T" back to the BOS airport.

Reviews.Title: “I can't imagine staying anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: MyTravelingescapades
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Chandler Inn (Boston) Dec.14 2011. It was exactly what I wanted. I was hoping to experience an (all too brief) immersion of Boston Culture. Gretchen was helpful with pre-trip info regarding public transportation, sightseeing etc. Glenn was the over the top great, educating me and sharing wonderful stories and history (some off beat) about the Boston area. He guided me to some perfect spots. I wanted local color/less tourist. He sent me to DELUXE (1 block away) for a fabulous late night dinner that turned into a great evening socializing with friendly Bostonians. The hotel offers clean well decorated rooms, comfy beds at affordable prices in a wonderful neighborhood . Handy for walking and Transportation. Short walk from the Back Bay T station. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, best value”
Reviews.Author: fleabagger
Reviews.Content: Over the last 15 years I have stayed at the Chandler 20+ times. The location, price and comfort can not be beat! I have never turned on the TV once!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: LesGarsBarbus
Reviews.Content: I stopped at the Chandler Inn twice: once on my way to my vacation in Europe and the other on the way back. It's a great location, nicely decorated rooms and very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay there agin next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: mrsashleywilbur
Reviews.Content: The Chandler Inn Hotel was the perfect getaway for my husband and I. The staff was so nice and very helpful. The room was beautiful... Very modern, no frilly flowered pillow shams or ugly wall hangings. The bed was super comfy, the best sleep I've had in a long time. The bathroom, while tiny, was very clean and I love the marble walkin shower. We were close enough to walk to nice places to eat, close to the T, and awesome deal with the parking garage... Half off with validation. I got an awesome rate, $99 winter special with an extra 10% off for booking non-refundable on their website. We will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “just nice”
Reviews.Author: katya1990
Reviews.Content: it is new, but also old. Really nice room, a little bit noisy! not so far from metro, but far from center! it has good restaurants around and chines area! ))

Reviews.Title: “Small space, huge charm”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: Set in a great Boston neighborhood, The Chandler Inn was a nice alternative to other, pricier options. We were only staying for a night, but I researched our options heavily before booking as I am very picky about where I will lay my head at night, and we were on a budget. What we found was a warm, welcoming, CLEAN, and stylish spot to call home while we took in a game and visited friends in the city. The rooms were very small, but were maximized by scaled-down furniture and clever uses of space. If we had children, it would not have worked. But for a couple out and about in the city, it was just perfect. The staff were so nice and helpful, and the halls and rooms were so quiet we felt like we were the only guests there. In a few words: bread and breakfast charm and comfort, city style and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good price point, but somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KatzNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chandler Inn for a Saturday night. All considered I was somewhat disappointed. While some of the disappointment might be attributed to bad luck, enough of my less than ideal experiences here were due to poor decisions by hotel staff to warrant this writing. First off, I arrived at the hotel at about 7pm. I communicated my two requestsâ€¦.that I have a quiet room and ideally have a firm bed (I knew this would be a long shot in any hotel). The attendant did make an effort to give me a room on the 7th fl (of 8) to hopefully limit street noise, and the bed was firm (for a hotel bed). Although I knew this was a â€˜boutiqueâ€™ hotel, I was still somewhat surprised at the small size of the room, and in particular the bathroom. Admittedly this might have been a result of my expectations being disoriented. The room was very nicely appointed given its small size, the TV channel selection was more than adequate (Direct TV), and the included wireless internet functioned as promised (with a password from the front desk). So what were the problems? When I arrived at the hotel, I noted how packed the streets were with parked cars. On-street parking looked to be a real long shot. As I was checking in to the hotel, I inquired as to parking options. The only option that was formally presented to me was a self parking lot about 3 blocks from the hotel. I was told that the hotel would validate my parking ticket and I would receive the â€˜specialâ€™ rate of $27 for the period of noon to noon (NOT a rolling 24 hour period). Even though I wouldnâ€™t be parking the car until 8:30pm, if I didnâ€™t leave the lot by noon the next day, I would incur an additional fee. Even having come from Manhattan, this didnâ€™t seem like such a good deal for Boston. I expressed my surprise, and insisted there must be better options available where the hotel doesnâ€™t receive a kickback. I was told that they receive no compensation for customers utilizing that â€˜dealâ€™ and there was no better deal. After dropping my stuff off in the room, I started a web search for parking options. Low and behold, the same lot the hotel directed me too offers online discounts of $19 for full 24 hour periods, and substantially less if you departed early morning or stayed for a shorter period. This deal required printing out a paper coupon. The next morning I called the front desk (different clerk) to inquire if they could print something for me, and they were accommodative. When I went down to the desk I directed the agent to the parking website, and he immediately deduced what I was going forâ€¦he then commented that he had a bunch of the vouchers already printed out. He handed one to me. The night shift clerk didnâ€™t volunteer didly about this and suggested there were no opportunities to lower my parking costs! This left a very bad taste in my mouth. As for the room, I immediately noted how warm the hallway leading to the room was. When I entered the room, the room was also warmer than I like. I couldnâ€™t get the AC working. I went to the front desk to inquire, and the clerk came with me to my room to try to assist (â€˜Aâ€™ for effort). We both fiddled with the handheld a/c remote control unit to no availâ€¦the fan in the unit wouldnâ€™t come on. He suggested I open the window a smidge, but that would allow all the street noise in. Even though I relented, there was meaningful condensation on the window due to the extreme temperature variations. (It was very cold in Boston that night) I also learned how razor thin the walls were. My next door neighbors were a couple that was apparently MADLY in love and VERY ENERGETIC. I could make out every sound and/or moan she would make, and they didnâ€™t tire out until 2:15am.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paris-kitty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chandler Inn in October 2011. Boston is an expensive city to find accomodation in and I think you will be hard pressed to find anything like the vallue for money the Chanlder Inn offers in terms of location, neighbourhood and room appearence. The staff were all very friendly and I was very glad I chose to stay at the Chandler Inn.

Reviews.Title: “"home away from home'”
Reviews.Author: kissmpeck
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Chandler often over the last decade for business-this time to celebrate an anniversary and birthday. We have seen the hotel steadily upgrade their services and rooms with an eye to comfort and a relaxed good time in Boston. Very well located. (This time we walked both to the ICA and the MFA.) All of Copley Square in one direction, Chinatown in the other. Highly recommended. Yes, a fridge would be nice for a longer stay but they have a coffee bar in the lobby, a convenience store around the corner, and Billys for the best breakfast deal in Boston three doors down the street. Hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: herrek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chandler Inn for three nights recently with my daughter. The price was reasonable for Boston. The room was nicely decorated although the public areas were a little worn. Close to the Back Bay subway/train station and a nice neighborhood with restaurants, coffee shops, etc within a few blocks. No breakfast at the hotel but free coffee and internet. All in all a good place to stay without spending a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a nice area of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Efrem_Brazil
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Chandler Inn for three days and certainly would return to it. The hotel is very well located and has a good price for its services. The only setback for me was the lack of small fridge in the room. The room is small but is enough for a short stay and for 1 or 2 persons. A very good thing was the free espresso coffee at the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: muzzawyse
Reviews.Content: The South End is our favourite part of Boston, and this hotel is the perfect distance between Back Bay and Tremont Street. We had a lovely view of the Hancock Building and though the rooms are fairly small, they are stylish and clean. The Delux Cafe down the street is great for a drink and Metropolis Cafe on Tremont was our favourite brunch. We'd recommend getting your coffee outside the hotel however; their coffee machines in the lobby aren't great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,close but disappointed with bar noise right beneath us.”
Reviews.Author: brian b
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small,but we didn't mind that really. It was also very clean which was a big plus with us. Also,it was within walking distance to many things,including Public Garden. We even walked to TD Garden,which was only 35 minutes or so away. The one disappointing element was the sports bar located in the hotel. We were on the second floor and the bar was right below us. There was considerable noise coming from there until 2am some nights,there was also cigarette smoke wafting into our room when we had our windows open. That being said,the noise could've been louder. The structure of the building must be concrete because we were right above the bar and it sounded further away (though still loud...cheering and music). Overall,we did enjoy it. The bar noise was less on weekdays and a non-factor a couple nights but the weekend was bad for it. We'd like to stay there again as the staff were very friendly and helpful with their recommendations. We'd just prefer to be on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “You can walk anywhere from here and its not expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Alun M
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and 2 boys here in July for 4 nights. Both rooms were clean, bright and functional. Staff were very helpful , we even left sun glasses by mistake and they posted them on to us. Nice cafe around the corner for breakfast. Will visit Boston again and would have no qualms about booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good fit, depending on your needs”
Reviews.Author: nl404
Reviews.Content: Great location. Tiny rooms. Reasonable price, in Boston terms. Only real gripe I had was that I reserved a room with a queen bed. It was a double bed. I doubt there's a queen bed in the whole building. When it comes to Boston hotels you can't have it all, unless you're willing to pay $250+ for a room. So you have to make trade-offs. The trade-offs here were worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: Dims57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was perfect. A small room with no view, but very modern, clean and had everything we needed. There was an ipod dock, radio, TV, etc. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but you don't need one because there are great cafes, restaurants and bars just a couple of minutes walk from the front door. Billy's cafe was great for breakfast, very "local" with great coffee. The Butcher's Shop on Tremont is a must for dinner. We walked from the hotel to Boston Common to start the Freedom Trail and catch a trolley ride so the location is very central and handy. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, the room rate was very reasonable - everything you need for a city break hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Spot when in Boston”
Reviews.Author: cxb56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Spetember of 2011 at the last minute for one night. Great accomodations in the Back Bay for a value. The staff was very hospitatiable and made great recommendations for dinner. Would stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Chandler Inn- Pleasant stay and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Okies151
Reviews.Content: My son and I were traveling to Boston in June 2011 and weren't sure where to stay. I conducted a lot of research on hotels in the Boston area, some quite expensive as you can imagine. Then I found the Chandler Inn. After some research on Chandler Inn, I booked a two night stay. This is a small hotel ( 60 rooms or so ), but the rooms, which are also smaller than usual hotel rooms, are nicely appointed. This was our first stay in a European style hotel and I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and helpful. Chandler Inn is located in a nice area of Boston. We walked from our hotel to Fenway both during day light and after 10 PM ( returning from a game ). The route we took was approximately 2.5- 3 miles and the walk was pleasant and safe. There were many other pedestrians along the route we walked , who were eating dinner at local restaurants or having drinks at the outside tables. The hotel is also located approximately three blocks from the T station and there is a convenient store and laundrymat just down the street. As far as the cost goes, we saved a tremendous amount of money staying at the Chandler Inn. For the time of year we were in Boston, rates on other hotels can reach $300-400 per night. Our two nights at Chandler Inn was about $160 per night. What a pleasant surprise! We really enjoyed our stay at Chandler Inn and when we come back to Boston, we will stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay....”
Reviews.Author: mike c
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night only in town for a show...good location in South End...friendly, helpful, clean and generally very quiet for this location. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a most convenient location close to downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Billbobstew
Reviews.Content: Similar to others especially friendly informative front desk.Clean adequate but small rooms.free wifi close to restaurants and amenities. Brilliant

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: contentedlady
Reviews.Content: Echoing other reviewers, good location and price in a city where hotels are very expensive. Easy walking distance to Tremont Street with excellent choice of restaurants. Also easy to walk to the Common, Beacon Hill, etc. Comfortable, clean room and helpful, friendly staff on front desk. Not luxurious, room on small side but location, staff and value outweigh these factors.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle R
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough nice things about this place! My boyfriend and I stayed there for one night at a great price, with plans to see a concert and tour the city. The hotel staff was so nice and helpful with suggestions of things to see and do. The hotel is very clean and modern. I couldn't find many reviews on it when I booked the trip, so we kept our fingers crossed for a decent place because it was so inexpensive. We were very satisfied with the location (walking distance to almost everything) and the great condition. Perfect place for anyone who is looking for a nice place to crash while visiting the city! Will definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, excellent use of space”
Reviews.Author: SwannTraveller
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at the Chandler Inn becuase there was a massive convention in Boston and all my usual hotels were $400+ a night. The Chandler was a bargain in comparison. The location is great - very cute brownstones all around, only a half-mile to the Prudential Center, and in a very charming neighborhood in Back Bay. The hotel is small, as are the rooms, but they made a great use of the space available. Beds were comfortable, and the heating/air conditioning unit worked great. The staff was very friendly. I arrived on an early morning flight before a full day of meetings, and they worked quickly to get my room ready so I could freshen up. They also welcomed me every time I came in and out, and they have a great coffee station. The internet was fast and reliable and served my purposes. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy but nice.”
Reviews.Author: Andrine48
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. My only complaint was the lip in the shower isn't high enough to keep water from leaking out of shower onto the floor. Desk staff were friendly and very helpful. Elevators were very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: sammyliz01
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a weekend trip to Boston, where we stayed at the Chandler Inn and were very pleased with our experience. We had a queen room and found the space to more than adequate for our trip since we didn't spend much time doing anything other than sleeping there. The bathroom is very small but serves its purpose -- all you need to do is take turns. It is in a fantastic location, less than 3 blocks from the Back Bay T Station, and not too much farther from anything you need. We hardly used the T at all during our stay because we could walk everywhere. We got a great price, $199/night and would've paid almost double that to be just a few blocks closer to Downtown/Prudential Center/etc. Free wi-fi too! Very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: Matt05074
Reviews.Content: What a great find in the heart of the city. The staff were very accommodating when I wanted to change my 2 bed room for one with a Queensize bed. The fact that the hotel does not have its own breakfast room is easily made up for by the to eateries around the corner. For dinner, there are wonderful restaurants in 5 minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend visit Boston My son & me”
Reviews.Author: Marius V
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel that just was renovated a litlle while a Go ! The rooms are Not so Big but they have everything You need and are very cosy. At 5 Minutes from the South end where the best Pubs and bistro's are located. We had dinner at 28 degrees & B&G Oysters. Two Recommenders !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent for the price, being 7 minutes from good restaurants, 2 minutes from a good breakfast and about 10 minutes from the Common, all walking. Disappointing no tea/coffee making in the rooms but a machine in the lobby provides good brews. Rooms are clean and although minimalist in a modernistic way (only just coped with all our luggage), they worked reasonably well and we were comfortable there. Staff were great and I definitely recommend it as a base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Vert good boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichH75
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed on two occasions at the beginning and the end of 10 days in New England. The hotel is in a good location with most things in walking distance. There are good restaurants / cafes nearby and a nice bar downstairs (although a gay bay we were made to feel welcome). The rooms are of good size although not massive. They are decorated in a modern style and in my opinion excellent with the second room (301) having two large windows and a nice view. The room and bathroom on both occasions was clean. Reception staff were all polite and helpful. Only slight issue is that you need to run the hot water in the shower for 5 minutes before getting in. I'd happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Trip to the South End”
Reviews.Author: njmack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend with a business nearby. It was very appealing as it was very reasonable. The rooms are incredibly compact, but good use of space. The person at the front desk explained that they were at one time Coast Guard barracks. All the rooms are exactly the same size regardless of bed size. We had a double twin room. The rooms have been renovated and are very modern. The bathrooms are incredibly small, but functional. I would stay here again for a quick turn around trip (one night) for the value. It was in a perfect location and right around the corner from our dinner reservations. All in all, it worked in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GreenTraveler312
Reviews.Content: Very cute boutique hotel. Clean and modern. Great location - a short walk to downtown. My only complaint was that the beds were a little uncomfortable and the walls were thin. Great staff - very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Visitor”
Reviews.Author: 813travel
Reviews.Content: I have to give this hotel visit a poor rating, imagine waking up on a Sunday morning after a night out dancing on the town, to discover no hot water available. Taking an ice cold sponge bath and then facing a 4 hour flight home. I had asked the indifferent staff on checking out to please have the manager contact me and that I felt that I should be compensated with a rate adjustment for my inconvience. It is now a week later and I have received on contact from anyone at the Chandler until this trip advisor arrived. Would I stay there again? No. Would I recommend this hotel to friends? No. It is sad that businesses just want your dollar but do not care if you had a good experience or not. My prostest is that I will just spend my dollar's eleswhere on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ManWhoseHeadExpanded
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a few nights at the Chandler Inn. It's in a great area with several good restaurants and bars. The staff was unusually friendly and helpful. If that weren't enough, the rates here are much lower than the bulk of Boston hotels. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: girlande
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice stuff, great location! I would definitely go there again when i visit Boston the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: zxcv6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group in town from out of state. The room was very nice, very clean, and very new. I stayed on the 3rd floor, which was recently renovated. Loved the HD flat screen TV on the wall with Direct TV service. Loved the big walk in shower. Room is small, so be ready for that.. but its a boutique hotel, so you kind of have to expect it. Internet was free and fast. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bluesman80
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the kindness of its staff. They were all cheerful and helpful. We spent one night there with my girlfriend. Our room was clean and well decorated. It was facing towards the street, but was quiet if the window was kept closed. Bathroom was perfectly cleaned and there were enough clean towels for both of us. The location of the hotel is good, if you want to spend your time in downtown. The only problem we had was there was no free parking near the hotel. We had to use a public lot which is a few blocks away. They make a little discount for the hotel guests. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: globalbetty1
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister, mother and I stayed here in early August of 2011 and highly recommend it. The South End location makes it super convenient to walk anywhere and it is safe to walk at night to dinner or theatre. The desk staff went out of their way help with recommendations and directions. And the guys at the downstairs bar were fantastic - made us some memorable martinis! The only issue is that the room sizes are small, but as we were hardly in our room - it wasn't a big deal for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy, ok room”
Reviews.Author: BBVRome
Reviews.Content: Having gone to college in Boston I know the city well and was happy to find a room for under $200 right in a central location for a recent trip to Boston with my husband. After reading reviews here and checking prices of other centrally located hotels we decided to book at the Chandler. We used booking.com and got a rate of $170 which turned out to be $196 after taxes. Not cheap for a hotel room, but it was Boston in the summer...The surrounding area is quite nice and we always felt safe even coming back in the dark. Check-in went smoothly and we got into our room just after the 3pm check-in time. It was on the second floor close to the corner of Chandler and Berkeley and directly over the pub downstairs. The bathroom is basically a closet with a hand-washing sink and a decent sized shower. The room was on the small size but acceptable for a one-night stay. No closet, but place to hang things, nice tv and very modern furnishings. Overall it was decent but not exactly my taste. I felt that the place was overpriced for what we got especially when we were woken up several times during the night due to lots of noise from the pub downstairs and when they closed people stayed out on the street for quite sometime. Perhaps rooms on a higher floor are less noisy. The complimentary coffee and tea is in the very small lobby and comes out of a generic machine, so nothing one would likely make use of. There was a cafe' around the corner on Berkeley St which looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place at a great location”
Reviews.Author: sheilashih
Reviews.Content: This is a nice boutique hotel located in a beautiful neighborhood. There are restaurants and shops in walking distance. Major attractions and transportation can be reached in a short walk. The room was modern, clean, and very well designed. Basic amenities like ice, hot water, and complementary coffee tea are available close by, but there is no frig in the room. Parking is a bit problematic, considering the location. You have to park in a lot paying top dollars even with hotel discount. All and all this is a very good place to stay while visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel - with a friendly team”
Reviews.Author: bxllgrg
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 5 day stay with this boutique hotel. The staff were always happy to help, and polite. Very clean and modern. Very good value by Bostons standards Great location, and great sports bar (gay) downstairs. 9 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Cute, chic hotel in Boston's South End neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: nikolai_podgorni
Reviews.Content: I moved here on my 2nd night in Boston after a less-than-stellar stay in a hostel in the Back Bay area. I was lucky to book a one-bedroom with a queen size bed for two nights at 1:00 in the morning. The price was pretty decent given that the average going rate for bigger hotels at the time I visited was around $200+/night. Since my move was last minute, I didn't do enough research (I moved here because of the price and availability), but I was pleasantly surprised. Overall, the location can't be beat (a few blocks away from a "T" station, Trinity Church/Boston Public Library and Boston Common). The staff was helpful and friendly, and the Sports Bar attached to the hotel had decent brunch Sunday morning. The hotel room reminded me of boutique hotels in Europe. The bathroom was a little on the small side, and one can sometimes hear conversations in the hallway, but for the price, location and cleanliness, it can't be beat. I will stay here again if I ever come back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Wandy712
Reviews.Content: My friend found this hotel for an overnight trip to Boston, and I must admit I was afraid of something that described itself as a Budget Boutique Hotel. But it's just that. Boutique for sure, since it's small, yet very tastefully designed and decorated. Budget, well room price was very reasonable for being in the middle of a great neighbourhood. Room was small, as was bathroom, but very clean and great for the quick overnight trip. Loved the location and the ability to walk to train station if needed, as well as lots of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean Room but a bit far from the subway and not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: bsymomof2
Reviews.Content: The carpet and bedding in the first room they gave us felt damp and they promptly gave us a diferent room, so I consider that's the good but the front desk definitly are not very friendly and not very helpful when asked for directions and eateries. The room is small but with nice decor and clean. My big thing is it's far from the subway, a solid 18-20 min walk, it's walkable but it's tiresome after a long day of activities.

Reviews.Title: “A real nice place”
Reviews.Author: facthcheckr
Reviews.Content: A very nice property in a cool and funky neighborhood. Thanks to Kevin, David, and the other staff for their recommendations and assistance. Very convenient location to access the train, and the many many fine places to eat and drink, both in Back Bay and South End.

Reviews.Title: “attractive, though small room. nice area”
Reviews.Author: eeamonn
Reviews.Content: Good - The Chandler was a very clean, well decorated boutique hotel. It is in a safe convenient neighborhood. It is within a few blocks of a T station, and a medium length walk of much of downtown Boston. The hotel was a great value in comparison to many others that I priced. Staff was very friendly and helpful in explaining how to get around. Less than Good - The normal rooms are VERY small. I was actually fine with this, but if you pack heavily or plan on spending a long period of time here, you may want to think twice. All the doorways, those to the floors, and the main entrance were really awkward. Holding open 2 doors that are really close to each other or right at the top of a stairwell, while dragging luggage is annoying. They should really invest in automatic doors. Also, there is no parking. If you drive it will cost $28/night, and is a couple blocks away. I pretty much expected this for a hotel in Boston, but figured I'd mention it. Overall I enjoyed the hotel and would consider a short stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and so cheap!!”
Reviews.Author: jasminejp87
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved it. I was a bit skeptical at first since you know: the cheaper the less of quality. But def. loved it. The room was super clean and chic. Yes it's a bit small but who cares!! There is so much to do in Boston that the only time you'll spend in the room is when you are sleeping. The location was great. Within walking distance of the shopping area. Lots of restaurants and bars to venture into. Would def. go back.

Reviews.Title: “Our address in Boston - every time”
Reviews.Author: Nicklius
Reviews.Content: The Chandler Inn has been our place to stay in Boston for as long as 15 years now! It has allways been very pleasant and service was excellent but now they have redone all the rooms and it is magnificent. The best value you can get in Boston. It has no restaurant but you can get a discount for the small and cute bakery just around the corner if you ask at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, staff, value.....a definite "yes"”
Reviews.Author: lucania
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant one night stay in the Chandler Inn in Boston. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is on the older, smaller side, but, has recently been completely re-done on the inside. My room was small , but attractive with nice amenities. The price was quite fair by Boston standards. The location is convenient near Tremont Street with it's many shops and restaurants. It was easy to find a good, reasonably priced restaurant with a healthy menu (Stephi's) within a few minute's walk. The neighborhood is quaint and charming with the typical Boston brownstones, brick sidewalks, original gas lamps now wired for electricity-- all of which made for a lovely after-dinner stroll.. The Chandler Inn is not a 4 or 5 star. It is small and basic. But, if you want a very decent, clean, attractive , well-run hotel with good staff in a good location, you will probably like it. This was an all around good experience . I plan to stay there again the next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Expected nice, surprised by just how nice!”
Reviews.Author: AbsoluteTomFL
Reviews.Content: I had been a patron of the bar downstairs (Fritz) for many years when I lived in Boston, and chose the hotel solely based on it's location and that i heard the rooms were "nice" from bar patrons. Though small (I travel in Europe a lot so the size is comparable to London hotels), I was very impressed with every little detail of the room - especially considering the price. While not the least expensive hotel in the area, the amenities are on par with the Copley Fairmont or the Taj! VERY comfortable bed, nice large flat screen TV, coffee (Flavia, which is similar to K-Cups) available in the Lobby at all times, amazing and friendly staff. Everything I wanted and nothing I didn't need. I highly recomend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AZ3
Reviews.Content: Bedroom Very hip vibe to the room. Nice new clean furniture. Good size TV. Everything very clean (I am a germ a phobe and never felt uncomfortable it all). Should mention that althg I didnt think we needed anymore room, it is smaller than a standard hotel room. Views Our corner room on the far end of the 6floor had 2 nice big windows that showed pretty views of the surrounding area. Location, location, location PERFECT. Felt very safe in the area and was able to walk to everything! We easily walked to the Garden/Commons, Prudential area, Chinatown, start of the Freedom Trail (thg did take the subway back to the hotel from Bunker Hill; subway is just 2 blocks from hotel). Took a taxi to the airport for $20 (however there was zero traffic when went so this price may have been us getting lucky). Bathroom For my 5 foot self the bathroom was perfectly fine but it is very small and if you are a bigger person it may be uncomfortable. You open the door, step in, and directly on one side (meaning without taking another step you can reach it) is the toilet and directly on the other side is the stand alone sink, then in front of you is the door to the shower. I personally liked the but shd mention the design is a bit different (not sure how to describe it but Ill give it a go)- glass door that while you are in the shower lines up straight with the glass shower wall giving you a good amount of space to move around, then when you are not in it the shower door closes inside the shower cutting it in half giving you a bit more room in the bathroom. I did not have a problem with the water leaking out but could see how this may become an issue for some. Loved the toiletries they provided-smelled and worked great. Only problem was I had was had to slam the door to get it to shut (probably waking all our neighbors in the process). Price- Great price! Best price I could find in this area and with the extra discount coupon I found on Tripadvisor got a rate that was even better than some average hotels that would have required a car to get anywhere. I would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnbi1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time it it def won't be the last. A lovely little boutiquey hotel which was perfect for a few nights in Boston to explore. Close to where I needed to be, the area was nice and I felt safe, I came back to the hotel late one evening well past midnight. The room is small, I agree with others but it's very well done. No wasted space but I agree with you couldn't have an extended stay here with more people. But for a short stay, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for $$ and location”
Reviews.Author: Xaverian77
Reviews.Content: Right downtown. Clean older hotel with a friendly, helpful staff and ideally located within walking distance of many downtown Boston points of interest. The theatre district is right there and Newbury St, the Commons, Fenway and the waterfront are all within a reasonable distance. The building is older but well maintained. AC worked great, the beds were comfortable and clean and even though the rooms were on the small side, very adequate for a single or couple. Great brunch at the attached bar on weekends as well. This is a "gay" sports bar but "straights" are welcome as well. The staff were very friendly there as well. Two dry cleaners were located within a 30 second walk and a couple of more local restaurants around the corner. We felt we received very good value for our $$$. Our bathroom although not overly large was well appointed in marble and tile with lots of hot water on demand.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Quaint, CONVENIENT”
Reviews.Author: gourlemb
Reviews.Content: As my first boutique hotel I was pleasantly surprised! Extremely convenient location within walking distance to Newbury Street and other popular areas. Connected to a gay sports bar with specials for hotel guests. Great coffee bar in the lobby. Beautifully decorated, very modern and art deco. I highly recommend this place. Great privacy, service, and location! Also, very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: rjwolfe
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Chandler are outstanding! Always friendly, they went the extra mile when we left our camera's battery charger in the room. They contacted us to let us know that they found it and asked us where we'd like it sent. It was waiting for us when we got home. Thanks to Zak and everyone at the Chandler!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean rooms, and nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: sanneMiami_Florida
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for a city/family trip to Boston. The hotel doesn't offer much more than a place to sleep but if that's all you need, it's perfect. The room is clean and styled with modern design furniture that I very much appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at Every Turn”
Reviews.Author: Kwalkerk
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 5 night stay with the folks at Chandler Inn. The staff was overwhelmingly helpful, the room was clean and efficient, and the location was perfect. My wife and I highly recommend this fine hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: pjl4825
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable clean room. Excellent location. Very helpful friendly staff. Small dog friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, nice, not too pricey.”
Reviews.Author: MikelWard
Reviews.Content: Located just outside the town center between Chinatown and Back Bay, walking distance to many restaurants and tourist attractions. Rooms were good. Recently renovated. Carpet could have been a little cleaner but standard level of cleanliness. A little pricey, but better value than many. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Mellaurenmac
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for 4 nights as part of our trip across America. Upon arrival the lady at the front was extremely helpful in providing maps, information and tips on what to do, all without even having to be asked. As we were arriving late at night, she even provided us with some take out menus for dinner! We stayed in a queen room on the eighth floor. Yes the rooms are small, but they are newly renovated and, I believe, completely adequate for a couple. The furniture and colour scheme are sleek and modern, and the bathroom has also been fully redone. There is free tea, coffee, hot chocolate in the lobby. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Boston Common and the theatre strip. We did the hop on/hop off trolley tour recommended by the hotel and it was a great way to see the city. Takes you to all the major tourist and historic attractions, and is fully narrated. Boston is a beautiful city and the Chandler Inn is on a quiet, tree lined street, where you feel completely safe to walk around at night. The hotel locks it door after 10 pm and the front desk is manned 24 hours, to let guests in, and provide an extra element of safety.It is also close to train stations. I would definately recommend to friends and would stay again myself!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Doug1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chandler Inn at the beginning and end of our holiday. On both stays we found the reception staff friendly, helpful and courteous. The rooms are fairly small but didn't feel cramped and they had hanging and storage space for all the unpacking we wanted to do for the 3 nights we were there. The rooms were very clean. Although the en-suite shower room was quite small the shower area was a good size so we didn't feel cramped in there and the shower was very good. Overall we were very pleased we choose the Chandler Inn and we were pleased to return there for the last night of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Modern cute room with closet-sized bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Andyc298
Reviews.Content: Just arrived & very surprised to see that the bathroom is actually the size of a small closet (with an actual closet door). The room is decent but definitely NOT worth the price!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: lifepsych
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at Chandler. The people who greeted us & checked us in were very friendly and helpful (Hi David! Our Yorkie loved you, too!). The South End is cool, hip, and fun and we want to come back and explore the area more. Loved the big tree outside of our room window. And, love, love, love the orange-scented creams in the bathroom. We didn't have time to use the pool, spa, restaurant, and internet but, if they're anything like the rest of the Inn, they're great, too. Ruby & Arthur O'Neill

Reviews.Title: “Never again -- biggest mistake ever!”
Reviews.Author: BelloftheBall29
Reviews.Content: I wasn't going to go out of my way to write a negative review of this hotel, however since the Chandler Inn actually e-mailed me requesting that I post to TripAdvisor, I've decided to oblige them. I have never been treated so rudely and unkindly by ANYONE, let alone a hotel staff person, as I was when I stayed at the Chandler Inn. Beware of DAVID at the front desk -- when I complained of my room smelling of cigarettes, he told me I should find another hotel to stay at if I wasn't happy with my room, because "they only want people at the hotel who are happy to be here."

Reviews.Title: “you get what you expect for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: mybloodyvalentine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Back Bay area, which is a walkable distance from downtown Boston. The staff did what they had to do, without being extra-nice either. The room was clean, cosy, slightly noisy (due to proximity to a street with a few cars) but we slept very well in a comfy bed. We didn't hear the neighbors. Breakfast wasn't served at the hotel, but we had breakfast in a nice cafÃ© right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Boston boutique hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: MMBonaire
Reviews.Content: We choose the Chandler Inn because of its location (a mere stroll away from Copley Square) and the great deal we got offered. We could not have been more happy during our stay in Boston. A nice city-hotel-style room, great shower, friendly staff (they even informed us about the Tornado warning in the area! Talking about caring for your guests!!) and a great bar adjacent to the hotel lobby. We were happy to stay here. It is great value for the money you pay. Don't expect The Ritz since you are not paying Ritz-prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Small but nice rooms. Walls could be thicker”
Reviews.Author: Matt35
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Its a short walk to great restaurants and the centre of downtown is only a 10min walk. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. As a boutique style hotel it served us well. The rooms are small, but more than adequate for a few nights. Probably a little too small if you are there on business and need to do work, but for us, on holidays it was fine as we were out most of the time. The only negative comment is that the walls between the rooms are thin. We could hear the TV in the room next to us very clearly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Btrtrvl
Reviews.Content: This was a great small hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is close to the Back Bay Amtrak station and easy to walk with a rolling suitcase. We were thrilled with our room. We were on the seveth floor and had a corner room with two windows and a perfect city view. (Must say that we had come from NYC with no view and a room we could barely walk around the bed.) The bed was very comfortable. Great shower. The decor was modern. The room was spotless clean. We liked that we could walk to Tremont Street at night and find lots of places to eat good food. Nice spots nearby for breakfast also. It was an easy walk to the Boston Common area. We also liked that it felt like we were in a neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: GePal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights when I went to a conference in Boston in May . Since I'm a grad student, and coming from a university, I had to choose something that wouldn't be ridiculously expensive, especially considering I was going there by myself. Based on the reviews, and compared to other hotels in Boston, the Chandler Inn seemed quite decent, with the newly renovated rooms and all. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were exactly as shown on their website (I had a twin room), although a bit small by North American standards, everything was clean, internet was fast and the location was excellent. I was a little worried that the Hynes Conference Center would be too far to walk to everyday, but it was a quick 10-15 minutes walk. I found that the best way to get there was to walk 2 blocks on Chandler st, turn right on Dartmouth st, go through the Neiman Marcus (or the entrance next to it) and follow the directions through the various shopping malls. The only downside to this hotel is that it was noisy. I was staying in room 201, which is the first room on the first floor of the hotel, next to the staircase/elevators. Fortunately, I never really heard noise coming from The Fritz and I didn't have trouble sleeping at night. But the walls and windows were thin. If I wanted to stay in bed relatively late in the morning (past 8 AM), it was impossible. The people cleaning the rooms were loud (although, admittedly, quite nice) and the doors... oh man, the doors!! People need to learn to NOT "bang" the doors when going out in the morning. It seems there was no damper (or buffer spring) on them... *BANG!*. That's the only thing that drove me nuts, haha. I wasn't in my room very often and I assume that most people going there on vacation/business wouldn't be either. If you're looking for a simple, little hotel to stay in for a few nights, this is it. I would go back, but I think I'd ask for a room on another floor. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: DWTravelTales
Reviews.Content: Nothing flash but good value, clean comfy rooms, bathroom a bit small but no big deal. Really friendly staff, complimentary hot drinks in reception, location fantastic, a 10 minute walk to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “More than just a "place with a bed", a wonderful staff and clever design to make your stay enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: CapeDan
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay with the Mrs. when we went to Boston to see the Dale Chihuly exhibit at the MFA. The Chandler was the perfect place to stay. The design elements of the hotel are modern without being off-putting. The desk staff was extraordinarily helpful in finding me a place to hide my car for the evening as well as some solid suggestions on where to have dinner the evening we checked in. The beds were comfortable, the room and bathroom were spotless and, overall, it was the best hotel experience I have had in a long time. Last year I spend better than 120 days out of the year in all sorts of hotels so when I tell you this place was "all that". it really was. I tip my hat to them. Great people, great room, great hotel. You should go!

Reviews.Title: “Go There”
Reviews.Author: EJWilliams
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chandler Inn for one night - i found the room to be clean and of enough size. The staff were so friendly and helpful. I thought they went above and beyond. Good location- not far walk from beacan hill. for the price, i would recommend Edward Williams

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique!”
Reviews.Author: brinalulu
Reviews.Content: Chandler Inn is a stay for the low maintenance. Modern & no-frill style. Comfortable, small rooms. The toilet was dirty so that was a very big turnoff. The overall cleanliness could be better in the hotel. At first site feels very clean but after awhile you sense a little more detail is needed - in the bathroom especially. The noise outside was a bit noisy - people leaving the bar. I suggest they add a booklet of: recommendations for take-out, area suggestions, history on the hotel could even be added, etc - a concierge booklet -- it's always nice to have available even in no-frills hotels. Free wi-fi was a very nice option - paying for wi-fi at hotels always still surprises me and makes me frown. The Chandler Inn could use some TLC - and not even major TLC just some sprucing/cleaning up. Overall nice stay and would again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful shower room at the Chandler Inn”
Reviews.Author: Nomad033
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel we were given to our keys to our room on the third floor. This small boutique hotel is perfect for the solo traveler or for two people. The bedrooms are smaller than usual but they are very nice which makes up for it. I was traveling with my mother and we had a twin room booked ( two single beds compared to the usual two double beds in other hotels). We had a flat screen TV, stylish desk and chair. The shower room is beautiful, marble style tiling and a good size shower with glass door. There is a tea, hot chocolate and coffee maker in the lobby as there are no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, but you can help yourself anytime. i would recommend this hotel and we booked on a third party website and got a reasonably good rate. Who really needs a gym at the hotel or room service anyway?, I would prefer to have a nicer room in a great location and this hotel delivers it! The location is great as its five minutes walk from Back Bay T station. On the other side of Back Bay T station you have Copley Place, a very nice shopping mall. Around the corner from the hotel are two cafe's and we visited them both for a good breakfasts. Thank you Chandler Inn for making our stay in Boston great!

Reviews.Title: “best value!!!”
Reviews.Author: bgeorge1959
Reviews.Content: This is the best value in Boston, the rooms are on the small side, but still very comfortable and clean.Great shower!! Location is a short walk to the Back Bay orange line, and a 120 min walk to the Prudential Center Green line. Would be my first choice for any future Boston stays.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Onyx76
Reviews.Content: It was very clean and the service was very nice. Friendly staff. Great location with nice rooms (may seem small for American standards).

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickym63
Reviews.Content: Positives: good location, rooms recently (and very nicely) decorated, friendly staff. Negatives: a bit nosiy, can hear noise crom other rooms/street/air conditioning. Bed mattress too soft. Rooms may seem small for American standards, but coming from London they seemed good emough for me. Overall, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “These guys should be in the hotelier training business”
Reviews.Author: KLBee
Reviews.Content: Although this is a basic hotel the service level was absolutely fantastic. We were there for 3 nights and every single person at the front desk was just fantastic. Location was great. Bed was nice. Rooms were clean. Free drinks at the front desk 24/7 - very thoughtful!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Kishkashta1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very lovely. It was also very clean and the service was very nice. Like!

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LavanyaLea
Reviews.Content: Came to Boston to attend a medical conference, found this hotel through Expedia, my priority at the time I booked the room was the location. I was pleasantly surprised when I got there, staff was very friendly. My room was on the top floor and it was an end room, hence I had 2 windows facing different directions. Love the funky little touches to the room (see pics)! I was jet-lagged and busy to prepare my presentation, so the midnight/early morning runs to the lobby to use the free coffee machine were very precious! The reception is staffed 24hours, so often I would stay a bit longer downstairs and had a chat with the staff, who gave me useful tips re: places to see, eat, etc. They also have an ice machine in the lobby, so whatever your preference for drinks, hot/cold, no problem! Wi-fi internet is provided free of charge, which paradoxically is not provided in high-end hotels (my boss stayed at the Boston Park Plaza and had to pay extortionate amount for internet!). Bed was so soft and the bed linen was so fresh and crisp. Very, very comfortable to sleep. Windows were thick and very successful at keeping the noise down (completely). It can get quite noisy if you open the windows (albeit only a little bit) for fresh air. Nice flat-screen TV, I also noticed a game console, I think it was Xbox 360 - unfortunately didn't have the chance to test it (are games provided in the lobby???).
