Very strategic location in the Back Bay area, close to subway, also nice to just walk around - I walked everywhere! I came in October so Boston was very very pretty with all the autumn foliage and the temperature was mild. Highly recommend this place, and I would stay here again, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Charm with little imperfections”
Reviews.Author: Marianne_Lib
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in general for price and quality. The service is great, people are nice and can suggest you good restaurants in the neighborhood. Everything was really clean and the coffee machine in the hall is really a great idea. I stayed there before the level where i was got under renovation: in fact they told me i was the last one to sleep in the room before renovations. Good idea because the windows let the wind and noise pass through, so it wasn't easy to sleep well. I'm pretty sure it has change now. Rooms are little, but some reviews describe them way more smaller than it is. Overall, it's a great hotel: if you want a place near the subway, with a great price and service, go to the Chandler Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Happy, Homely, Haven!”
Reviews.Author: pussywillow75
Reviews.Content: Great welcome; well-appointed room with fantastic decor; spotlessly clean; bed was a dream (literally) with lovely cotton bedding. Hot drinks machine in reception was a novel idea (not seen in UK). Will definitely return with my husband next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very plesant experience”
Reviews.Author: xnick115x
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice the staff was extremely friendly Very enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean, recently renovated inn”
Reviews.Author: jk121255
Reviews.Content: The Chandler Inn is located in the heart of Boston and in a very great for tourists. It's easy to get to the Back Bay subway station which services a lot of Boston's attractions, and is within walking distance of many restaurants and China Town. Boston's South Station, where a lot of the bus services to New York and other major east coast cities depart is a short cab ride away and it's about a $30 USD trip to Boston Logan Airport. Newbury Street is also within walking distance and the Faneuil Hall Marketplace a quick subway ride away. We stayed in a boutique queen room, which was small but clean. The inn must have been recently renovated because the room looked pretty new. The guy at the desk was quite helpful, and there was free coffee and tea in the lobby :) The only negative I would mention is that the Chandler Inn is located near the Massachusetts Turnpike. This wasn't a problem for me but if you're a light sleeper, the noise might be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: southernyankeebelle
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I recently stayed at the Chandler Inn and were extremely pleased with the quality and value at this establishment. The hotel is no-frills; a great place to stay if you don't need all the fancy hoopla. We were really pleased with how the room was maintained â€“ clean and beautifully decorated with modern furniture and fixtures. We're from NYC and would definitely rate it comparable to some of the best places to stay in NYC. It has a great history and the food at the hotel's restaurant, The Fitz, is phenomenal. If you're not used to NYCâ€“sized spaces, you might think the rooms are small but it didn't bother us in the least. The Chandler Inn will be my go-to hotel when I visit Boston in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: clm92
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very charming area of the city. I was very comfortable during my stay and enjoyed the feeling of high quality simplicity.

Reviews.Title: “My go to hotel”
Reviews.Author: simpsonmarkc
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when visiting Boston. It's an out of the way gem with newly renovated rooms. The size of the rooms, may be a problem for 2 people, but it's perfect for a solo traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Two Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: jfs0143
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, bathrooms nice, views beautiful, staff lovely, bed comfortable, the only down side is the walls are fairly thin you could hear people talking in the next room and snoring at night. I only wish that the walls were a tad bit thicker.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect fit for our college tour visit. Convenient location, clean, affordable, very pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: bfdaddio
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in Boston to visit law schools and tour their facilities. We chose the Chandler Inn because it was conveniently located near a "T" stop and because of the price. Since we were going to be spending a majority of our time out and about on several college tours and some sightseeing, too, we did not feel it was necessary to book a hotel with lots of amenties (pool, gym, restaurant, etc.) that we would not utilize. The Chandler Inn was perfect and a great fit for our trip. Our room was well appointed and clean with two twin beds and a small bathroom. The room was compact but organized and had everything we needed. We slept well. We ate breakfast just around the corner from the hotel at a small coffee/bagel/sandwhich shop which was very good and conveniently located with great service. Though we had to cut our trip short by one day due to a blizzard, we were very pleased with our accomodations. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would stay there again should my daughter decide to attend a Boston school.

Reviews.Title: “Major construction in progress”
Reviews.Author: Dizzi52
Reviews.Content: Made reservations and no one mentioned any construction going on. Was awakened each morning at 7:30am with banging and major construction. This happened each day Monday-Sunday, with no relief. The first room we were in was a corner room with two windows, the room got very cold. The flat screen TV did not work. We were transferred to another room. The heat was not well controlled by the thermostat, it took a long time to heat up. The rooms, bed, bathroom were very nice and comfortable. Pretty retro. The staff were very nice. With the construction ongoing I would stay elsewhere, closer to Quincy Market.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Naslund26
Reviews.Content: PROS: -very clean and nice rooms -well situated (5 minutes walk from BackBay 'T' station and short walk from Newbury st. and even downtown). -friendly staff (moved us to one of their top room after we complained of noise, keep reading...) -nice neighbourhood -free coffee (and pretty good too) CONS: -we've been awaken 2 mornings (out of 4) by construction workers on a lower floor and fire alarm (for nothing) at 7:30am. -wifi reception was pretty weak in the rooms. Had to go down to the lobby to check mails, etc. I would've given a 4 star rating but the 2 incidents in the morning forbid me to do it...

Reviews.Title: “Great location in cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben1982Manchester
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. It was in a great location, a short walk from Back Bay station, and had good character. The staff were helpful, the rooms clean and trendy and it was great value. Billy's Deli round the corner was a good place to get breakfast, but there was also another cafe and a 7 Eleven close by too. All in all excellent stay and we would really recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location with even better customer service and a great price!”
Reviews.Author: ale972002
Reviews.Content: The Chandler Inn was a great deal located in the middle of the Back Bay and South End areas. The best part was the helpfulness of the staff, and one in particular. He suggested great brunch and dinner places for us to eat, which were delicious. The rooms were a little small, but it was really all one needs. The only other complaint was the noise permeability of the walls. Overall, the service, location, and price are hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms But Large Value”
Reviews.Author: sdsailboi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were looking for a low cost hotel in the Back Bay close to nightlife and attractions. The Chandler Inn fit the bill. We were both a little skeptical because it used to have a poor reputation as a flop house. After visiting the hotels website, however, we decided to give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised. The rooms have been remodeled and are clean while the bed provided a comfortable place to rest. The only drawback is that the rooms are on the small side, but given it is Boston it was not too surprising. The clerks at the hotel were also very accomodating and allowed us to have a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average facilties and service”
Reviews.Author: fleeceylauren
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. We booked the boutique room but having stayed if I were to stay again I'd probably go with the budget room. Seems like they have the same facilities just not the lick of paint. The room was perfectly fine and the shower was great. Although there was a free coffee machine in the lobby we really missed having this in the room, it was inconvenient to head downstairs. There was also nowhere to get drinking water. This hotel really is in a fab location though, 5 minutes walk to back bay station. All in all a good hotel, I would've been more satisfied had I paid the lower rate for the budget room however as I think it was a little pricey considering the lack of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFULLY RENOVATED”
Reviews.Author: MaggieCassella
Reviews.Content: I was in town doing a show with Lea DeLaria at Club Cafe and we rolled in super late the night before. These peeps did everything to make our stay great. We were welcomed at 1am and taken care of beautifully for the two nights we were there. The rooms are beautifully renovated and everything was spotless. There's a sweet little club in the hotel too. I don't have a single complaint and would rec'd the place to anyone who asked.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the South End”
Reviews.Author: Spikeheimer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chandler Inn in the past and have been very satisfied. When I lived in Boston I always enjoyed going to Fritz's, the bar/restaurant for Sunday brunch and socializing. Check-in and check-out were quick and efficient. Special requests handled promptly (e.g. for extra hangers, an iron and ironing board). The renovated rooms are lovely. My only disappointment was that there was no bathtub. In my room, anyway, there certainly seemed to be enough room to include a bathtub in the space where the shower was. But the shower was very nice and roomy. And the coffee/tea/hot chocolate maker in the lobby--heaven!! You must try a chocaccino! I would certainly stay at the Chandler again, and recommend it to my friends. I give it four and a half stars out of five. Mike D.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: Austin78704
Reviews.Content: Never been to Boston and this was a last-minute trip. I booked this hotel because the price was very reasonable considering where it is located. It was a 5-minute away from Copley Place where I needed to go. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The room is clean and nice for a single traveler. It is pretty quite at night. 7-Eleven is 2 minute walk from the hotel and convenient. Very safe area. Nothing to complain.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: StudentTraveler09
Reviews.Content: clean, fairly stylish hotel in an incredible location for an unbeatable price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and well-priced”
Reviews.Author: lmborkowski
Reviews.Content: The Chandler Inn was much lower priced than competing hotels. The staff was friendly and the room was small, but clean and comfortable (we were on the 6th floor). There was some noise late at night out on the street from bar patron's at Fritz's.

Reviews.Title: “Calling this a European style hotel insults an entire continent.”
Reviews.Author: DTS83014
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that I had a bit of a problem going into my stay. I was going to Boston for a college visit with my daughter and made my reservation at almost the same time my wife made a different reservation at another hotel on Expedia. I called within 4 minutes of clicking the reservation through, but the front desk told me there was nothing they could do to avoid the no cancellation policy. When I arrived in my car, I found out there is no accommodation for guest parking, other than to offer directions to a public garage near a train station 3 blocks away. Neighborhood parking is permit only. The room was small, as anticipated, but at least it was poorly maintained. There is an abundance of deferred maintenance at the hotel and the room had a flop house quality, albeit with nice shampoo. The promised "free wireless Internet" was essentially moot, since the signal didn't reach the room - - and I was on the second floor. My daughter gave up after it took 5 minutes to load a single Facebook page. The noise from the bar downstairs wasn't awful, but it was there. The desk folks were friendly and professional enough, but the hotel gives them little to do other than check you in/out and send you on your way. In short, this is in a very nice location, but it offers little except the location to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel With Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: roxyfan
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly impressed with the Chandler Inn. The staff members were very helpful, the decor was exceptionally tasteful with many fine touches, and the location was terrific. Great neighborhood, easy, walkable access to Newbury Street and the Back Bay, short walk to the nearest T stop (Orange Line), and good breakfast cafes right around the corner- all this, at a very good value, too. We would definitely stay there again and definitely recommend it without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price, friendly staff, stylish rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly2009cats
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Chandler Inn! We were welcomed by a friendly front-desk staff, and were even able to get into our room a little earlier than check-in time (which was a welcome surprise after a day of airports and air travel). We stayed in a queen boutique room, which had a lot of great design details-brushed stainless steel ice bucket, bentwood tray, Chilewich-like pillows, and a flat-screen TV. We opted to add a tiny fridge to our room (for a reasonable daily charge), which was a great amenity to have available. On either side of the bed there were "nightstands" with two large, roomy drawers if you chose to move out of your suitcase. The location was fantastic-very close to the Back Bay T stop. Nice neighborhood to walk around in, felt very safe. We would highly recommend the Chandler Inn as a place to stay on your next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: AthonyJP
Reviews.Content: In a word, a stay at the Chandler is like stepping in to the past...in a good way! :-) Chandler street was a quaint, tree-lined street with brick and brownstone townhomes. As I stepped in to the small lobby, I was greeted by two older gentlemen who immediately made me feel at home. They gave me a map of the area and told me about the high-lights of the area. My room was at the end of a well lit, narrow hall reminiscent of the era. As I used a real key to open the door, I was greeted by a great view through two large windows. I could see Chandler street, an old brick church, and the skyscrapers of downtown Boston. The room was small with a freestanding closet that was also small. As a solo traveler, it was plenty for me and would be for a couple as well. The bed and pillows were clean. The linens were bright white and fresh. The climate control worked well. My business was by the Boston Common, and the Chandler was a wonderful 10 minute walk. The neighborhood felt safe with lots of pedestrian traffic that included children, old couples and business people. I was out at 6:30am in the morning and also as late as 11pm at night. I highly recommend the Chandler for anyone who is looking for a stay that is basic, clean and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in the Back Bay area”
Reviews.Author: Cheshire4Dave
Reviews.Content: Situated in a pleasant residential area within 5 minutes walk of Back Bay station with plenty of eating places nearby. Comfortable, clean room but the walls were a little thin, we could hear our neighbours clearly and the plumbing was also very noisy. The front desk staff were very helpful and were able to print our flight passes for us. Recommended for a short sightseeing trip to Boston

Reviews.Title: “Was not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: ColbeB
Reviews.Content: The hotel's website advertises itself as a "boutique" hotel. It did not love up to our expectations. Rooms are very overpriced for the size & quality. We stayed in a 'queen suite'. The room was so small the bed was nearly touching the walls. There was no closet, just a pole attached to the wall for you to hang your clothes. The bathroom was ridiculous, barely enough room for one person to stand, let alone two. Needless to say we will not be staying here next time we visit the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, accessible location, cozy clean room... perfect for those planning to spend their time out and about!”
Reviews.Author: jen_wanderlust
Reviews.Content: The Chandler Inn is situated in the South End, a couple blocks from the Back Bay T stop which makes it a great launching point to explore the city. You simply cannot beat this rate anywhere else downtown (I searched extensively!). The Inn is nestled on a street lined by brownstones and the bar beneath/beside the hotel is of no concern for noise or crowds. The standard economy twin room was perfect for my friend and I on our "girls weekend" away. Two twin beds with enough floor space to fit our two suitcases and walk around the beds (think: European boutique hotel). The room was spotless, decor and linen modern, beds comfortable. Be prepared for a small bathroom but it's clean and perfectly functional! Overall, the hotel is in a quiet location-- but you will hear your city sounds (a little traffic, nearby trains). The service was friendly and helpful -- they even have a gourmet coffee machine to help yourself to coffee, lattes, hot chocolate. I cannot stop recommending this hidden treasure to everyone I know. I frequent Boston often, and I have finally found a hotel that I will use again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Modest room, great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Denise095
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel on tripadvisor.com for its price and people's comments. We stayed two nights. One problem for us was the hotel took full authorisation for two rooms for two nights from our credit card from the day before we arrived, and didn't fix it by debiting only one room cost, for over a week, locking up our credit. The hotel is well located despite first impressions that it seems far away, you can walk to key areas in the city. The staff were friendly and very helpful. There is free wireless but my laptop wouldn't connect to it despite the extensive efforts of the young receptionist beyond the call of duty. The room was very nice with everything we needed, though a bit small. Overall it was reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the South End”
Reviews.Author: Royalstonian
Reviews.Content: Chose for location, I will be back. Wonderful staff, Great shower! I look forward to visiting again. Rooms are small, but adequate: and good size for an early 20th Century hotel. The coffee machine in the lobby was wonderful, and the staff was welcoming and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Rooms are not really inviting”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe243
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Standard Room, not a Boutique Room, which was probably a big mistake. Our room was not really inviting. It smelled like feet and the bathroom was really tiny and looked very grubby. The Personal was very friendly and helpful and the surrounding of the hotel is okay, too. There is no Parking Lot available and you have to park in a Parking House approximately 5 to 10 minutes by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: frances071
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. The staff were incredibly friendly. Located in a quiet area yet within easy access to travel links. Recommend the coffee shop around the corner, great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Upgrades. Great Small Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tpdx
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay earlier this month. I had stayed at Chandler Inn some years ago, before the upgrades to the queen-suite rooms. The queen-suites are nice! I recommend those. The common spaces are still a bit dingy, but not dirty. The whole place is clean. And the value for the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “4stars in a 2Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: itsallabout
Reviews.Content: Half the price, 2x service. Floors 4-8 boutique rooms, small, but excellent layout. Perfect for single business traveler. Front desk helpful, and engaging. Beds clean and comfortable, Water pressure strong, showers hot. Coffee shop around corner, and walking to great restaurants in south end.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: SFMGWestportCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chandler in mid-Oct. 2010. It was in the greatest location/neighborhood. The rooms were clean, modern and the shower water was nice and hot. Beds and bedding were wonderful. The front desk staff - including Cupcake (the little maltese) were welcoming, sociable, and helpful. Thanks Gretchen for a wonderful time at your hotel. Can't wait to come back to Boston and the Chandler Inn. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “Chandler Inn, Boston”
Reviews.Author: Buzzhombre
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a good value for Boston, a city which can be very expensive. The location is fantastic, about two blocks from Back Bay Station, four blocks from Copley Square, and walking distance to the Commons and Charles River Greenbelt. There are a multitude of restaurants in the area. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are bit small and spartan, although some of the upper floor rooms have been nicely updated. There is a lively gay sports bar on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “clean and stylish room for a great price”
Reviews.Author: jibs4000
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but I was only there to sleep. Location was good I could walk to all my events. Nice bar and eatery next door. Clean. Parking was a little bit of a walk.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: marygrace4
Reviews.Content: Chandler inn was a great place, located pretty close to places you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: CASRunner
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel in Back Bay neighborhood. While the room was small it was very clean and very updated/boutique-like. My wife and I visited Boston for a 3 day weekend getaway and explored the city and weren't planning to spend much time in our room anyway so we didn't care that it was small. We would definitely return to Chandler Inn if/when we return to Boston. I would give it 4.5 stars if I could. Billy's Sub Shop (down the block from Chandler Inn on Berkley) has great muffins and was a great spot for a quick, cheap breakfast. Giacomo's on Columbus was a great little Italian restaurant - excellent food and service.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: JenMc1
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time searching online for a Boston hotel that was both centrally-located and reasonably priced. Such hotels are apparently few and far between, so I was happy to find Chandler Inn. It met all my expectations- The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and pleasant, and the location was perfect for us- within easy walking distance of restaurants, attractions, and public transit. The surrounding neighborhood was pretty and quiet. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Location + Service + Great Price = Real Value”
Reviews.Author: abitofbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chandler Inn for one night during a week-long vacation to New England. Coming in from Logan Airport was a breeze (take the airport shuttle to the Blue Line T Airport Station and transfer to the Orange Line. The Back Bay station is a easy two-block walk from the Chandler). We were able to stash our bags in the lobby at 10 a.m. and get right to our sightseeing. We checked-in about 2 p.m. and our only glitch was that the first room they gave us hadn't been cleaned yet. After profuse apologies from the front desk staff, we got another room in just a moment and settled-in. We chose the Boutique room and loved the modern style. And I have to say it has the most efficient use of a 5-by-5-foot square space that I've ever seen - that's the size of the bathroom! But it has a spacious walk-in shower and a cute sink. It won't fit two people at a time, but you can get all your business done if you take turns. The wall-mounted flat-screen TV and DirectTV service was a nice touch too. The Chandler is in a lovely neighborhood that's a 15-minute walk from Boston Common and Beacon Hill and the very pricey hotels nearby there. We were happy to take a walk and save 50% off of what you'd pay to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for Boston”
Reviews.Author: BooKat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Columbus Day weekend when prices were high in Boston. Booked an unrenovated room for $159/nite, which was much cheaper than anywhere else I could find. The room was on the third floor over the lobby, so we did not have any noise from the bar. Room had a comfortable queen bed and wardrobe for hanging clothes. Bathroom was small but it had a new sink and toilet and upscale bath products. The tub/shower was old, but in decent condition and the shower had really good water pressure. Room and bathroom were very, very clean. TV, although old style, had a great selection of cable channels. Room had a big window that opened. The location is great: just a couple blocks down Berkeley to Tremont St. and its plethora of restaurants and a few blocks up Berkeley in the other direction to Back Bay. Staff were extremely helpful. For the cleanliness, price and location, I would definitely stay here again on our next weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “The best bet for your money”
Reviews.Author: emichie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, just a few blocks from the Back Bay train station on the orange line. The hotel rooms are smaller than normal; however we basically just needed a bed at night. They have the basic amenities. There could be a few more electrical outlets so you can charge your phone or computers. The staff overall was friendly. We were on the 2nd floor above the bar and we had the windows open at night and it wasnâ€™t that loud. Overall itâ€™s not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: TwitRobin
Reviews.Content: This was a good value hotel for Boston which is expensive. The room was not big but adequate. It was very newly decorated and clean. Bed linen was crisply clean. Bathroom was nice, if small. Particularly liked the walk in shower. The night we were there it was very hot. The air conditioning worked but had a noisy fan so it was a choice between being hot and sleeping in a wind tunnel, so we turned it off after cooling the room down. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in the South End”
Reviews.Author: DukeofDutchess
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in the 80s and 90s and it has had quite a renovation. New rooms are nice and the location, more than ever, is superb -- walking distance to the South End, Back Bay, Public Garden and Boston Common areas. Desk staff was friendly and helpful. It's pricier than it once was, but Boston hotels are expensive and so it remains a relative bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: bnhedrick
Reviews.Content: Well....where to begin? My husband and I just got home from our 4 night stay in the Chandler Inn. When we entered the hotel I was pleased with the appearance. Nice, modern, clean, the lobby, that is. The gentleman who checked us in was pleasant. When we stated walking down the hallway to our room we started getting a little worried. It was very small and tight. It did not look remodeled at all. When we entered our room we were horrified! It was tiny, not remodeled, and worst of all the bathroom was original to the hotel (maybe from the 1950's)! The room looked clean, but not like pictured on the website. Like I said previously the bathroom was the absolute worst. The tile looked filthy, I'm sure from years it has been there. I could stand in the middle of the bathroom with my arms out and touch the walls, and I am not a large person! Just way to small! The staff was pleasant, sometimes a little short. My biggest complaint was just the surprise of what I was getting myself into. Price was reasonalbe, but should be for what you're getting! Don't think I'll stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: jeff521a
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chandler Inn many times. The hotel staff is knowledgeable and friendly. the rooms are immaculate. The small rooms keep the hotel the most affordable in the area. Only strange thing was the selection of TV channels. Heavily right wing (Fox news and the Military Channel) and no MSNBC or Comedy Central.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PucBuny
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Chandler Inn for 2 nights..Room was SUPER...The Front Desk people were GREAT! Very Friendly. Room was very clean,stayed in one of the newer rooms on the 5th floor..We have stayed at this hotel every time we have gone to Boston and would stay here over and over again..Only 2 short block away from the " T " at back bay station,you can take the train everywhere GREAT GREAT GREAT!...thats all i can say is that this hotel is the best to stay at when staying in the City..close to everything and if not you take the train which is right there...There is a bar right down stairs from the hotel and two great food places right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “While at the Chandler Inn, Drop Into Billy's Sub Shop”
Reviews.Author: blessed0580
Reviews.Content: No doubt prices for Boston hotels are high. Our research showed us the Chandler Inn is one of the most reasonable. The Chandler in September of 2010 had renovated rooms on upper floor and older rooms on lower floors. We stayed in both (a complimentary upgrade thanks to management). The lower floor rooms are a challenge in their small size (e.g. no lamps at bedside for reading, electrical outlets difficult to access), no place to put the luggage for two travelers. While the upper renovated room are the same square footage, space use is improved dramatically not to mention decor improvements. The staff is friendly and the neighborhood (southside) is walkable to the Commons, Copley Square and local restaurants. The hotel was quiet enough with the windows closed to street noise. The owners of the little coffee shop/cafe around the corner the Chandler on Berkeley Street were most accommodating and packed up large sandwiches for a reasonable price, separating our onions in one container, our tomatoes in another, simply to keep our sandwiches from getting soggy and smelly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBMS
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, about a five minute walk to the Back Bay Station. Nice neighborhood with very good restaurants, not a lot of traffic. Very easy to walk to nearly every neighborhood around Boston. Clean, comfortable rooms (we stayed on the sixth floor). Bathroom is very small, but that didn't bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Basic.”
Reviews.Author: Sportbluehorse0
Reviews.Content: Noisy bar on ground floor. Bathroom so small can only accommodate 1 person at a time - if you are slim! Room smelled of damp. No safe or refrigerator, only one bed-side table. Pay more and stay in renovated room on top floors. Toiletries are fab.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Quilter149
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel after picking up a guest from France. I was of course wanting to make a good impression. The staff were very helpful, charming even. And the room was immaculate. Small, but trendy and immaculate. Probably not big enough for a week long stay, but perfect for our overnight. We enjoyed walking around the neighborhood the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and modern rooms with lovely toiletries”
Reviews.Author: bckpckrau
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept 2010 and was very pleased with our level 5 room - clean, modern paint, great photo on the wall of the Boston skyline, comfortable beds and large LCD tv with cable. The room was on the small side but cleverly designed to fit in all of the necessities without feeling too small. The shower was a double with a folding door and unfortunately it leaked substantially on the floor each time we showered so we went through a lot of towels trying to keep the floor dry. Also, the street is a little noisy at night due to people and traffic on the cross street, but there is a great iHome ipod dock alarm clock in the room so we docked the ipod, put on some nature sounds and slept well. Front desk staff are ever helpful and a bonus is the coffee making facilities at the front desk. I'd recommend this place to anyone staying in Boston and interested in being in the South End close to back bay station.

Reviews.Title: “I felt Chandler Inn a very friendly and acquainted place even though it was my first ever visit to the USA.”
Reviews.Author: leela_avula
Reviews.Content: I would like to personally thank the General manager and all the staff at the front desk for their excellent and friendly approach. I shall never forget their assistance and cooperation. It has been a wonderful experience for me to be in such a beautiful place like Boston. I had a very comfortable and cozy stay the Chandler Inn. I would certainly recommend it to my friends. I look forward to visiting Boston again and to stay in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Gav99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in may. The rooms were clean and tidy which for me is always the most important. The location wasn't great as it is around 8 blocks from the nearest sightseeing but the T station is only 2 blocks away. There are plenty of restaurants just 2 blocks away and a 7/11 just around the corner. The staff were friendly but when we arrived there was one stressed guy trying to serve everyone at once. He checked us in hurriedly at the same time as dealing with a complaining customer and giving directions to a passerby who came in. I would rather have waited and been given some attention as he hardly spoke or even looked at us during check in. Also the reception area is just a small desk at the foot of the stairs. There are no coffee making facilities in room but there is in reception along with an ice box. There is free wi-fi but no computers so if you don't have any device with you like us you can go to the YMCA opposite and use theirs for a dollar. Overall though the rooms were nice and quiet and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “G8t location G8t formula”
Reviews.Author: ptownsley
Reviews.Content: A brlilliantly located hotel, with a simple, winning formula - Comfy, city accomodation at an affordable price with friendly, informal service. There are so many good places to eat in the vicinity that the absence of a restaurant is not noticed - and never mind the lack of a gym , pick up your heels and walk around those marvelous south Boston and Back Bay streets

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: DJKaze
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Chandler Inn in Boston, which is very excellently located (1 1/2 blocks from train station and 3 blocks from lots of fantastic restaurants). It's a no-frills hotel, so there aren't many extras (like a gym, pool, room service, etc.) The rooms are a little on the small side, but they're very comfortable, clean and newly refurbished. The free wi-fi came in very handy when I needed to do some work projects. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location.”
Reviews.Author: EricParker
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful friendly staff. Nice clean hotel. Having food and bar on site big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, funky spot in a great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: atlantis30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the unrenovated rooms, so it needed some cosmetic work, but the rest of the hotel was very nice, and I would definitely go back. We had no noise from the bar even during 4 straight days of Sox games, and the hotel staff was great- very friendly and very informative. The neighborhood was also good- close to the T, Newbury Street, Tremont Street, and many small restaurants and clubs within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but great value”
Reviews.Author: Marichikogirl
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Chandler Inn and we were quite pleased with the cost. The staff was friendly, the room was clean. The location was in a very quiet neighborhood in close proximity to the T station. We wanted a very basic (i.e., inexpensive) place to have while we were out sight-seeing. That being said, the bathroom was smaller than my closet at home and the furniture looked to be from Ikea. As long as you aren't looking for luxury, then this was a very nice place to stay. I would definitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: catgirl111
Reviews.Content: We found it difficult to find accomodation to meet our budget. Boston is quite a pricey city, and we did not want to spend more than $100 per night. The Chandler Inn is not a lavish hotel, but offers all the basics you will need for your stay. During the four days we stayed in Boston, we found the room to be good value. It was comfortable and clean, with good air conditioning and a large plasma tv. The bathroom was clean and spacious enough. The room was decorated in neutral colours and it was a pleasure to get back to the room after a full day of sightseeing. We found the location convenient, and the staff friendly. The area is quiet, and so we found we could always get a good night's sleep. This is a great hotel if you are not looking for something lavish with lots of extras.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Vale23
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Boston and during our search we found it very difficult to find a "cheap" hotel, meaning not having to pay 200â‚¬ a night. Chandler Inn is a good compromise. We paid 90â‚¬ a night for a standard room (their cheapest). The room was essential in furniture, and the bathroom was tiny, but at least it provides a/c, wi-fi connection, satelite tv and signature tiletries. Parking and breakfast are not included, but there is a cofee machine at reception that can be used for free. The reception staff was very helpful, they allowed us to check out one hour later without fee and stored our luggage all day, also without a fee. The hotel is near the Back Bay T station, not far from the Public Garden and John Hancock Tower, and in a quiet residential area. If I have to tell the truth, I think 90â‚¬ a night (ca. 120$) is a lot for a queen bed and a tiny bathroom, but that's one of the cheapest hoels you'll find in Boston, so go for it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at the Chandler Inn in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Espressomocca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chandler Inn for three nights and had a wonderful time. The staff were very friendly and helpful with maps, restaurants, taxis etc. They even phoned the car rental service for us. The hotel is very nice and clean. The design of the hotel and rooms is trendy. We had a Boutique Queen room which was really nice, very clean and very roomy. So was the bathroom. We loved the plasma TV and the walk in shower. The location is good; the park, Newbury Street (for shopping) and Prudential Center are within walking distance. The hotel doesn't offer breakfast but there are diners and cafÃ©s around the corner. We will definitely stay there again if we go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Euro-style in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: 5thsun
Reviews.Content: Very stylish yet affordable Hotel, minutes from Boston Common and other attractions. Nice touches like iPod-ready alarm clock and remote control A/C. The only flaw was that the small bathroom either didn't have a fan, or it was broken in our room. After 2 people took a shower, the room was pretty muggy. Also, parking is off-site a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, price and location!”
Reviews.Author: ultrasonica
Reviews.Content: Don't bother with the older (and harsh) reviews from a few years ago, the hotel has been completely renovated since and is now a cool "boutique" style hotel, in a great location and with the friendliest staff we met after 2 weeks in the US. The rooms also look new, greatly designed and cozy, maybe smaller for american standards but large for europeans like us. They have a deal with a nearby parking lot too, useful if you drive there (really hard to park in Boston without a resident permit). oh, and free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: edinburghej
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great! Staff very friendly and hotel in an ideal spot - close to Boston Common, Cheers and Boylston and Newbury Streets!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotlessly clean & comfortable. Perfect for what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: StuartOrton
Reviews.Content: Really good, great base to explore Boston. Very clean & tidy, some great restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, helpful staff, great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: akabyam
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to via public transportation, gorgeous rooms and a friendly helpful staff all at a great price

Reviews.Title: “Good place but terrible room neighbour”
Reviews.Author: tamarco85
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty good and the location is fantastic but we had a bad experience with noisy room neighbours and a misunderstanding related to a double payment

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Bahston”
Reviews.Author: AustinBostonlover
Reviews.Content: Really cute boutique-y hotel with a great vibe! Love the decor and feeling of history there. I loved this hotel and staff. I really want to go back soon. The Chandler Inn was in a great part of town too! Thanks for the great experience! Go Red Socks!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: bigham0078
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and the location was close to everything we needed.er

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: janjanmmm
Reviews.Content: Very average place at best. Large room, but dated and not very comfortable. Hotel had a strange dog-like odor. Staff did not seem especially friendly, although not downright rude either. Location is close to the center but the area is not the nicest. Would not stay there again, at least not for the price ($170 a night)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: pjanecki
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about my stay The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms, which were recently renovated were very clean. The location is perfect as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff who scored home runs with...”
Reviews.Author: Buckhill2
Reviews.Content: Great staff who scored home runs with recommendations for restaurants. Great bar on 1st floor. In a wonderful location on south side. Highly recommend this boutique hotel and its affordable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent springboard for a fun weekend in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: cucinalisa
Reviews.Content: So glad to have found this needle in a haystack in one of our favorite American cities. Boston is forever in our hearts and Chandler is definitely in our pocketbook! The property manager Gretchen was extremely generous when we questioned a bill. Thank you for your gracious hospitality. We will return sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: “Residential area hotel and for Boston its a good price.”
Reviews.Author: TACOB0B
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night at the Chandler in late June 2010. In May 2008 we had stayed 3 nights for a weekend get a way and decided to try it again. What we like about it is that it is a few blocks down and a few blocks over from the Back Bay T station making it a convenient base to explore Boston. So if you are just looking for a place in a safe area, that is clean, this is your place. The rooms are small. The standard room would remind you of a basic little family run motel room, which we booked in 2008. This year we opted for the updated boutique room which had a nice AC unit, big walk in marble shower, and a large flat screen T.V. But keep in mind that this is all in a very small room. The shower itself was 75% of the total bathroom space. The carpet in both the rooms is very sad. And for us we couldn't care less about the T.V. but if you like T.V. it is a nice touch. There is 24 hour desk service and you can make hot coffee or tea in the lobby which is also very small. There are no restaurants, convenience stores, or shops nearby except for a gay bar which is attached to the Chandler. We don't have a problem with this we only wanted to note it as it may be an issue for other travelers. All in all it is a great base for exploring Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on a Small (Hip) Scale”
Reviews.Author: bangsezmax
Reviews.Content: If you are into big box luxury hotels with giant lobbies with tinkly pianos, this one's not for you. If you like your hotels sort of funky and cool, but with a deluxe feel, this is it. My room was small, but with beautiful, stylish decor, free wifi, and a great shower (no tub). The location is just off the theater district, in a quite neighborhood. Front desk folks are charming and helpful and there all night. Comfy bed, excellent pillows, and toilet paper origami. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RetiredGoer
Reviews.Content: Spent three days in Boston taking in the sites. The Chandler Inn was a 10 minute walk to the "T" and close to some great food. Staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms were small but clean. No tub but I consider that a plus (we are not tub people). Billy's cafe around the corner was GREAT for breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: NorthernTraveler69
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well decorated, comfortable and clean. Only criticism would be the size of the bathroom. Although completely functional -- excellent shower, it was a particularly small. The folks at the desk were always friendly and cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: MJicote
Reviews.Content: Great location - came up from NYC for client meetings, took the Acela and was able to walk to the Chandler from Back Bay Station. Clean, quiet room with good flat screen for the game and wi-fi so I could work. Quick cab to the financial district in the morning (front desk called me a cab and let me know when it arrived) - and finally when I was at the train station and ready to head home, I realized i had left my train ticket in my room! The staff at the Chandler immediately searched my room and found I had inadvertently thrown it away! But they secured it! So a quick cab back to grab my ticket and then a few block walk to Back Bay Station and I was off. Thank you Gretchen & Kevin at the Chandler. Couldnt be nicer - Matt NYC

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ra_massey
Reviews.Content: Boston can be an expensive place to stay but Chandler Inn is definately worth searching out. It is located in a trendy part of town which is quiet and residential but within easy walking distance of town and it is close to the Back Bay T line. When we arrived at the airport we decided to take a taxi for $30 but it would be quite easy to use the subway to get from the Airport. It all depends on your budget and how much stuff you have to carry. We stayed for 3 nights and had one of the more expensive boutique rooms. The rooms are stylish and modern and are everything you need. There is free coffee in reception but breakfast wasn't included. Attached to the hotel is a bar, but its nice, friendly and there was no noise from the bar to disturb you. Parking is limited to the street but Boston isn't really a driving City. I would suggest arriving in Boston, do everything on foot and if you are travelling on get a car from Hertz at Park Plaza for when you leave ( again with-in easy walking distance from the hotel ). If you are doing this, take your bags to Hertz rather than leaving them at the hotel and driving back. We got lost in the one way system getting back to the hotel. The staff were always friendly and helpful. A very good place

Reviews.Title: “They spared EVERY expense when remodeling”
Reviews.Author: randiritt
Reviews.Content: The reviews, website and pricing of the Chandler Inn Hotel made me think it was the perfect choice for a 3 day stay in Boston during June. It's well situated - only a few blocks from the Back Bay T stop - and the small size made me think 'boutique hotel'. While the staff couldn't be nicer, just about everything else could. My room was small, dank smelling and had a 'queen sized bed' that was surely no larger than a double. The bathroom was appalling. It was tiny and the tiles were cracked and old. The shower had a pipe with a hole at the top rather than a real showerhead fixture. In general, there were no amenities to speak of - no tissues in the bathroom, not a pen / pencil or piece of paper, only an armoire style box for a closet. I could barely fit my suitcase in the room without tripping over it. The TV/Cable barely worked (very basic cable) and there wasn't even an extra chair to sit in save the plastic (yes plastic!) desk chair. Ick. I had hoped for a bit more. For an extra $20/night, I found a few nearby chain hotels. I am no luxury hotel gal but I couldn't stay. I checked out the next morning (they were kind enough to allow me to do so without penalty) and went right to the Radisson (which was delightful).

Reviews.Title: “Nice little gem in the Back Bay area, Moderately priced. You can't go wrong!!”
Reviews.Author: heat1968
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chandler Inn May 17-20 and it was the perfect 'base' to soak up the Boston atmosphere. It's nestled in the beautiful Back Bay area, right in a residential neighborhood and is walkable to all kinds of restaurants, and the "T" Back Bay Station for transportation. The rooms are on the smaller side, but I already knew that by reading other reviews. I actually got to see both the 'standard' rooms and the 'boutique' rooms. We didn't feel the need to pay the higher price for the boutique, since we were just there a couple days siteseeing around Boston before traveling down to Cape Cod for a few more days. But as it turned out, the internet did not work in our standard room so they upgraded us to a boutique at no charge. Yes, both are pretty small rooms! You got to give up space for location sometime. I also highly recommend the Old Town Trolly tour. Even though you can walk to many of the sites from the hotel, the trolly lets you see much more, and really gives you a feel for the city. You get 2 consecutive days riding, and can get off and on at any of the stops as often as you like! It rained our 2nd day, so it sure came in handy. We visited the New England Aquarium - another MUST - We were there 4 hours, and not because of the rain. It's an awesome aquarium!!! Pros: Price, accessability, cleanliness, friendliness and helpful staff Cons: Small rooms, but adequate

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great price, very easy”
Reviews.Author: JoeStave
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a chic boutique offering two blocks from the back bay station. Parking is off site, but not extremely difficult. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were nicely updated with AC (with remote), flat screen TV's, nice sheets, and modern bathroom. Although the rooms are small, they are perfect if you don't plan on spending a lot of time there. GREAT CHOICE OVERALL, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Chandler Inn will now be my Boston home!”
Reviews.Author: chardon7
Reviews.Content: The location is superior - walking distance to Calderwood Pavilion for great theatre - as well as restaurants and shopping. The south end is a fantastic place to wander and people watch - Chaldner Inn makes it wasy to enjoy all the amenities of the areas. The staff is friendly and helpful, room are lavishly appointed and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Seattleite5262
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. My room was super clean and comfortable, with cool stuff like free wifi, ipod charger, flat screen TV and a very comfy bed. Loved the full length mirror when getting ready to go out! There's no AC in the room (well, I couldn't find it), and Boston does get humid, so plan to shower, etc. early or your room could get sauna-like. Helpful, friendly, knowledgeable staff with a sense of humor! Yummy coffee drinks in the lobby. The location is ideal, just a couple blocks from the T with many shops/eateries nearby. The Fritz, next door, has the coolest servers/bartenders and the best Bloody Mary you could ever dream of.

Reviews.Title: “good location in Back Bay area”
Reviews.Author: iii
Reviews.Content: in a quiet area; 10-minute walk to Back Bay station, Copley Place etc. suites on higher floors have been renovated and upgraded--flat screen TV, card key etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant visit, small room”
Reviews.Author: dcwessel
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful. Room decent but small - bathroom really minimal (shower doesn't really close and water can get onto main part; tiny space). Internet decent but a bit tough to connect to initially.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: smith3576
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a great location for the price - we paid under $150 for a room. See other reviews for more detail on the location. Service was very very friendly. It is a small room and very basic but was fine for us. Our only problem was the noise (similar to other reviews) - we were right by the hallway entry door for our floor and it was VERY loud opening and closing. It kept waking me. I was also woken up by people out in the street leaving the bar. Seemed to quite down by midnight (midweek) but we were exhausted by a long day of traveling and were trying to get to bed early. I would suggest trying to get a room further away from the hall door and/or bringing some ear plugs. Otherwise it was great!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: burcutan
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff was helpful. The neighborhood is pretty. The location is very convenient. Room was small but for the price it exceeded my expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: p2ny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night. High prices for a very average and ordinary hotel in an uninteresting part of Boston. Not the friendliest of staff at the front desk but polite and efficient. Room was small and the bathroom really tiny (but clean and smart). No breakfast available in the hotel (you have to another hotel or restaurant outside!) I wont be going back and wont be recommending this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: larryw79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chandler Inn during my brief trip to Boston in April 2010. Pros: the service is great, and the location can't be beat. Good price for my room. Cons: The bathroom left a bit to be desired, especially the shower head. I stayed in a room above the Fritz, so there was a bit of noise from the bar at night. All in all, I would recommend this hotel if you're looking for an inexpensive place to stay in Boston. If possible, find out if you can stay in one of the more recently remodeled rooms, as I hear they are quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SFTravel45
Reviews.Content: Great location, very convenient to public transport, great restraunts and night life.

Reviews.Title: “European Style with Unbelievable Service”
Reviews.Author: rclander
Reviews.Content: We were recently in Boston for the marathon and were lucky enough to find the Chandler Inn in a wonderful part of downtown. Short walk (~10 minutes) to the heart of Boston and easily accessible by metro. The rooms are compact, modern, and clean. Finally, the staff are amazingly friendly and helpful. We would highly recommend the Chandler Inn as the best value inn in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, Price, and Service”
Reviews.Author: seka16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the Boston Marathon. Its price was great for what we got. Perfect location only blocks from the Boston Commons and all downtown has to offer. The rooms were all redone and in great conditions. The best part was the staff- so friendly and willing to help with anything and everything. They even let us check in super early! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: DaveyBoySmith123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during a two day stay in Boston. As my flight from New York was delayed for a week after the volcanic ash extravaganza, I decided to explore another city. The Chandler Inn was the cheapest decent hotel I found. Location is superb really, unless you are lazy and can't manage the 10 minute walk into the city centre! Area is decent, although a tad noisy during the night, but I guess that is to be expected when you are in the middle of a city. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and helped with all the queries I had. The rooms are decent, the only complaint I would have is that my shower didn't seem to have any sort of a filter, so the water just sort of sprayed out and was quite painful on the back of the neck! But size wise as I was on my own they were fine. Decent selection of TV channels as well! The city itself is much smaller than I imagined, and you can walk pretty much everywhere. Would recommend Bill's coffee shop for breakfast, as someone else did further down the page. Cheap and tasty! Overall, if I ever went to Boston again (which is unlikely) I would stay here again, without a doubt

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gonenutty
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel. We were in one of the older smaller rooms, poor noisey aircon kept us awake. Staff were v. helpful and friendly. Location was a little off the beaten track and felt like it was away from the buzz however everywhere was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A Lot for your Money!”
Reviews.Author: RoseyBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for my needs; very friendly staff, intimate and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Solo Travelers”
Reviews.Author: nikmonroe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff who were only to happy to help. Location makes it a little hard to to walk everywhere but the subway is only a couple of streets away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and convienant”
Reviews.Author: liz05782
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very friendly. The rooms were very clean. The hallways were a little warm and the room was a little warm, but the window opened nicely. Plenty of towels and hot water. An easy walk to down town (Boston Common), trains, very nice coffee shop around the corner, close to nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Ttown if you are frugal and fussy”
Reviews.Author: oregonvermont
Reviews.Content: Real deal: Friendly staff, nice accomodations, great location, and good prices. I do not think this can be beat in Boston. Larry from Eugene Oregon

Reviews.Title: “small & friendly , staff was very informative & smiley :)”
Reviews.Author: discolata
Reviews.Content: everybody made us feel very welcome , they gave us a lot of advice on boston ! we really enjoyed staying at the chandler inn...it's conveniently located , not expensive .. we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It felt like a small European hotel”
Reviews.Author: CvGNorthNJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance to shopping and great resturants.Located in a residential area, we were happy to find this hotel at this price in Boston. The bathroom is small but well appointed. Overall, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “I've been the Chandler Inn many times but...”
Reviews.Author: icman
Reviews.Content: I've been the Chandler Inn many times but this is the first since their renovation. They made it better in my opinion. Clean, modern, friendly staff, great neighborhood, near Amtrak's station in BackBay. What mire can you ask for. My only "complaint" is noisy neighboors but that's a given when you travel. Bring ear plugs or a white noise machine. My visit was mid March, 2010 weekend. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “I had an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: mercury7115
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay with the hotel. It was convenient and close to the center of Boston. The hotel personnel was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great style for an affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_G1
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed that this hotel had a lot of style for such an affordable price. the staff were very friendly and helpful and the location was very convenient to walk to the sights!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, poor room maintenance/cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: tripad_usr
Reviews.Content: The room had a broken frame window so it wouldn't close completely. Carpet wasn't clean. Some rubbish from previous traveler(s). Not a great location if only coming from and going to airport. No shuttle. If short in budget good price though.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: rockin62
Reviews.Content: Adorable boutique hotel. Comfy beds. Modern decor. Not a lot of hot water though for shower and no parking available. Had to park several blocks away on the street in a questionable neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, older hotel needs some work, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SFArea2010
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed in the economy twin room. It was small but worked fine for us since we were out and about Boston most of the time. The bathroom door would not close completely and the chain lock on the room door did not fit properly. Coffee, tea, and hot chocolate are available in the lobby. It's a great location, just 2 1/2 blocks from the subway and easy walking distance from downtown. The staff was very friendly and offerred great recommendations for places to eat. We were also given coupons for $5 toward breakfast at as choice of coffee shops around the corner. Both places were pretty good and they let us combine our coupons. There's a gay bar next door.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: prloverNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Excellent quaint and cozy hotel. Yes the rooms are small, as is the bathroom, but the service from the front desk to the housekeeping staff is first rate. The front desk answered all my questions thoroughly and even offered advise of what to see and where to park along with where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Just about value for money”
Reviews.Author: DJ10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice suburbian area with local cafes to eat as the hotel doesn't have a restaurant. Boston isn't a cheap city for hotels, but this is one of the cheapest. The rooms are clean and relatively newly refurbished but the bathrooms are pretty basic and very small. The street noise is VERY NOISY and you can hear every car and lorry (lots of vans and lorries as the road is quite busy). Also, every time your neighbouring room flushes the toilet or has a shower you can hear it pretty loud. Subway is very close and an easy way to navigate the city. Copley square is within walking distance too and there's lots of good shopping there. Overall the staff were good and it's a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5-Star, but a Great Option for the Budget-Minded”
Reviews.Author: michelec
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel rooms in Boston under $200 are next to impossible to find, so I was very pleasantly surprised with my room at the Chandler Inn. I stayed in one of the recently renovated Boutique Queen rooms. Yes the room was smaller than what you would find at the chain hotels, but it was spotless and nicely decorated, and the bathroom was all marble with a walk-in shower. The size of the room didnâ€™t bother me since I was there alone, but it might be a tight fit for two (for instance, after showering I had to step out of the bathroom to dry off because there was no room to move around). An iPod dockable clock radio, blow dryer and a large flat-screen TV with satellite high-definition channels are the only in-room amenities. An iron and ironing board are available upon request at the front desk. There is also free coffee, tea, and cocoa available in the lobby 24 hours a day. I found the staff to be incredibly friendly and helpful, and they were quick to share tips on what to see and do in town, as well as the best restaurants in the neighborhood (for a good breakfast thatâ€™s real easy on the wallet go around the corner to Billyâ€™s Coffee Shop). The location is hard to beat with the Back Bay T stop/Amtrak Station just a couple of blocks away. If you canâ€™t survive without the pampering and amenities of a 5-star hotel, then this wouldnâ€™t be the place for you. But if youâ€™re looking a reasonably-priced, basic, clean room in the center of town you canâ€™t go wrong with the Chandler Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but nothing special. Ok value.”
Reviews.Author: JJZH_9
Reviews.Content: The Chandler Inn is ok - nothing more, just a place to drop one's suitcases and sleep overnights. Rooms (I stayed on one of the 8th flloor "desgner rooms" for four nights) are clean enough and spacious enough, but with very very slow housekeeping service. Front desk service: varied - some brilliantly friendly, but the old blokes (if you are unlucky enough to meet them) bordering rude. The attached bar "Fritz" seemed like the most unwelcoming place I have ever visited - certainly not recommended, unless you are REALLY desperate for a quick drink, amongst the local cliquey queens. Overall, rather disappointed, and I would never consider Chandler Inn for my many imminent business trips to Boston in the future. The air-conditioning in my room was not functioning at all - at least I could open the window at this US hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would Use Again”
Reviews.Author: ladIreland
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but in good location, staff very friendly. Rooms a little dated but clean and safe in a lovely area of the South End.

Reviews.Title: “good rates of boston but you pay for what you have”
Reviews.Author: brunoTN
Reviews.Content: just spent one night on a business trip at the chamdler. good value for money in boston. i had a renovated room on the 4th floor. small room and bathroom but still good for a business trip. good location too. isolation of the rooms is not great, quite noisy (tv of the other room & street)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jefcgrn
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed our stay at the Chandler Inn. It was our first trip to Boston, and the desk staff was very knowledgeable about where to go and how to get there. They really knew Boston, and were friendly and helpful. Room was small but comfortable and clean. Only negative was that the shower was like showering under a fire hose, but at least there was good water pressure! Breakfast at the restaurant attached was excellent and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest People in Boston?”
Reviews.Author: Rowanad
Reviews.Content: I thought that given the excellent service the staff at the hotel gave me a positive review was the least I could offer so let me start with first impressions. I arrived at the Chandler (one block away from the bus station so a good start) to find that for some reason the third party booking company I had used had cancelled my reservation. The staff were fantastic. They checked me in with a calming drink while we waited to get a resolution where as they could have quite easily kicked me out on the street. On fixing my problem I found that the team there consistently provided me with excellent advice on where to dine, what to see in town, best forms of transportation and all and, in the case of the Night Porter, recommendations on classic and independent British Cinema. The room was spotless, and was always cleaned by the time I came back to the hotel after a days sightseeing and the location is very good. It's a ten minute walk to Boston Common for the start of the Freedom Trail and about the same to the Prudential Building for anyone planning to got up to the top of the Skywalk. There is also a T station just across the street. As already pointed out the Hotel doesn't have a restaurant attached to it and the only bar is a bit heavy on fellas (turns out it's a gay sports bar so that sort of figures) but the Berkley Cafe around the corner does wicked omlettes and a good cup of coffe. There is also all you can drink coffee in the hotel lobby. As for dining, I found that the staff at the Chandler had a range of local menus and were able to give restaurant recommendations and directions to make things a little easier. So I would definitely recommend the Chandler Inn to anyone. Compared to other local prices it was a snip at about $300 for 3 nights in September. Most other places, that were only marginally closer to the Back Bay area were almost twice that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nastyunia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Chandler Inn Hotel at the beginning of September 2009. The hotel is situated at a 5-7-minute walk from the Back Bay Amtrak/Orange Line station in a residential area featuring rows of brownstones. The check-in went smoothly, the guy at the reception being efficient and friendly. There is a coffee-machine in the lobby of the hotel, which became a pleasant surprise for me, as I like to have hot tea before going to bed. I had a budget queen room on the third floor. The room was rather basic (a bed, a wardrobe, a nightstand, a desk and a TV), but clean and pleasant. The bed was soft and comfortable. There are a few things that can be looked upon as drawbacks: - the air conditioning system is not particularly state-of-the-art. But, as it was not hot outside, 15 minutes of active conditioning was enough to cool the room and sleep well till morning. - it is sort of noisy in the evening/at night, as there is a bar downstairs. But I got so tired that I slept like a log anyway. - no breakfast is provided. But there are a few places to have breakfast right next to the hotel (although not all of them were open on Labour Day weekend). However, I can live with the above-mentioned things, so I still rate the hotel quite high, as all my requirements (safe location, cleanliness, friendly staff) were met. Overall, it was a pleasant stay coupled with a great time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the new room designs”
Reviews.Author: 2-guys-glasgow
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a great stay again celebrating my birthday - road trip gift to myself - this time in one of the new upgraded Boutique rooms - in room 8 on 7th floor which was very clever of Gretchen (Manager who remembered me from a previous visit - very unusual in this day and age) as that was my birth date. Booked direct with Hotel and did dinner & breakfast included. Dinner was at MASA around the corner - very welcoming and attentive, food first class - waiter very good and actually interested in you as a person not as a source of tips. Ordered house Margaritas - think the bar tender left the state whilst pouring the liquor - very, very strong!! Be warned! Breakfast coupons for coffee shop next door - smoked salmon bagels and green tea included. Would stay again - with no hesitation - this hotel is not a chain - is in a great location - central but not in the middle of the city - great for the subway network.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Man at check-in very RUDE”
Reviews.Author: kathaleeny
Reviews.Content: First of all, I want to say that this is a very NICE hotel. Our room was wonderful, a bit small, but very nice. Check-in is where the problem was. I first went in, (I am a 58 year woman, who had been traveling all day and wearing shorts and a t-shirt, and minimal make-up on, needless to say, I did not look my best). I asked if there was a room available for the night, the young girl behind the desk started to answer, when this very RUDE man says "We are full up". Now I had a feeling it was a lie, so I went to the car, got onto Priceline.com and made a confirmed reservation. My husband walks in to check-in, and all was well. He was treated fairly and very nicely by this man who just rudely brushed me off. My husband was also wearing t-shirt and shorts, so I don't understand why the difference in treatment. We were given a lovely room and really compliment the hotel on the rooms. The best part of checking in was the "priceless" look that the RUDE man gave me when I walked into the hotel with my husband, and then his nicey-nice "I gave you a wonderful room with a view".

Reviews.Title: “Less Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: brownkey
Reviews.Content: Our room and bathroom were both fairly small and very basic, much older and lower quality than what is shown in pictures on the hotel's website. There were only about 3 feet between toilet, sink and shower, and with no fan in the bathroom it would get quite hot and stuffy. Our air conditioning barely blew out any cold air even with the fan on high. In the middle of August in Boston you definitely want some decent air conditioning! It was also SO loud we had to use our earplugs from the airplane to get any sleep. It kept making a loud crackling noise and every once in a while it would have a fit and sound like it was going to explode. The front desk area looks so nice and fancy that it made our room an unexpected disappointment. There are no extras with this hotel other than a coffee/tea machine at the front desk. The staff is helpful and friendly, although some of the management seem a bit pretentious. If you can get a good rate and a room with a working AC unit I would still recommend this place. The location works well since it is fairly centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise! Loved the Chandler Inn!”
Reviews.Author: 2WrldTrvlrs1032
Reviews.Content: We are very impressed by how the Chandler Inn has made the most of the resources they have. It is obvious that they have put a lot of time and effort into making this hotel as nice as they can, and have done a great job. I have high expectations when it comes to travel in contrast to my value-seeking husband, so I was a little reluctant to stay at the Chandler Inn when he told me about it. I thought there was no way that it could be as nice as described at such low prices, but I was proved wrong. It was even nicer than what I had expected. The value cannot be beat, especially in such a convenient location. The decor throughout the entire hotel is very stylish, modern, & unique. The rooms are a little small, but they have definitely made the most of the space that they have. The rooms are extremely clean and neat. The furniture is brand new and very modern. The beds are very comfortable, with very clean linens. The room does not have a "hotel" smell at all. There is a nice flat-screen TV with DirecTV. There is an ipod player in the room. It is obvious that they have paid attention to details to make their guests' stays as enjoyable as possible. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE the bathroom! They have also made excellent use of the small space in the bathroom. The walk in glass shower is very nice with room for 2. I would love to use some of the ideas from the bathroom in my own house. We had no issues with anything at the hotel. It was quiet. We never heard anything or anyone else. Check in and check out was quick and efficient. House keeping did a great job cleaning and replacing towels and toiletries. I must say that the Chandler Inn may not be for everyone.... if you are looking for a 5 star hotel luxury and that is your only standard, then this hotel may not be for you. I do have high standards but as a young couple, this was perfect for us. I LOVED the unique charm and didn't want to leave! It is in a great location in a really unique neighborhood with a subway stop 2 blocks away. I would absolutely stay at the Chandler Inn again and recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique experience!”
Reviews.Author: trubbling
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Boston with our 8 month old son so bought our own pack and play which fit in nicely beside the bed. The staff were very helpful and friendly which i was not expecting travelling with ALL of our luggage. The room was small but extremely well appointed. Everything we needed was stylishly included! We had a wonderful time and would definately stay there on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up - Great Hotel, Great Location, Even Better Staff”
Reviews.Author: traveler506
Reviews.Content: What a great property. I have heard about the place for many years but never stayed there. The location cannot be beat. Easily accessible to Copley, the Commons and the train station. You dont feel lost here. It is very safe and is located around the corner from some incredible restaurants. Great deals based on availability. I stayed in one the renovated rooms and I have to say they are perfect. Internet signal was strong and the staff were very helpful. Kudos to the desk staff who are always willing to give directions and help out. Two particular staff were exceptional - Jim and Kevin. They truly made me feel at home. Will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in the middle of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Abbrecht
Reviews.Content: I just go back home from a perfect stay at the chandler Inn in Boston. If you are planning a trip to Boston you can't beat this hotel value for money. After a rough first night at a room on the first floor the accommodating staff was happy to move me to another room which was excellent. The hotel is renovated very tastefully, the location is awesome,I were able to walk EVERYWHERE and I found the pricing to be very low for a new boutique hotel in the center of Boston. The staff was patience and attentive and always willing to go the extra mile in order to help.

Reviews.Title: “good quality budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoboesque
Reviews.Content: It's a nicely renovated hotel, the rooms are modest but well designed. The internet works. There's no tea/coffee in the room (but there is in the lobby) and no bath (just a shower), so it missed two of my "must-haves"... But the staff were helpful and pleasant, it was a very reasonable price, and the location's fine, close enough to most places I wanted to be. Breakfast is at either a cosy cafe round the corner, or the workman's cafe two doors' down. I paid a b'n'b rate, which was $5 more than the regular rate... and got a $5 voucher to use at either of the two places! No complaint about that, but not much point either.
