There's parking at the back. For the price, I have no complaints. Very pleasant and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, no services”
Reviews.Author: CBTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the remodeled rooms. I walked down the stairs and it appears only two of the floors are renovated, several are under renovation, and several are not. Negatives: 1. Lobby is just a registration desk - so sitting area, no bar, no restaurant 2. Rooms are tiny 3. No closet in room - there is a rack on the wall to hang clothes - mine just had 2 hangers 4. No mini-bar in room, no ironing board, no iron, limited storage 5. No workout facility 6. The bar is a gay bar 7. No attached restaurant 8. Tiny bathroom Postives 1. Location 2. Rate 3. New flat screen TV with Direct TV I personally would not stay there again, but if you want a cheap well located room, don't mind the lack of amenities and don'd mind staying in a hotel that caters to a gay clientele, then this might be your place.

Reviews.Title: “Bait And Switch Act !!”
Reviews.Author: torlane
Reviews.Content: well i had all good things to say about the chandler inn until today. Upon staying there over the past couple weeks while apartment hunting in the city, we were first given one of the redone boutique style rooms at the rate we found online...this continued thru everytime we came back or extended our stay with them up until today...We had the nice remodeled room last night, and upon extending today was downgraded to one of the floors not remodeled and a lot less appealing, because that rate falls under the catagory for that room.. Talk about bait and switch! The worst customer service i have ever experienced. And ive been in the industry for ten plus years! Bad move!

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: janefromcairns
Reviews.Content: in nice leafy street, old fashioned room , comfy bed , we had 2 windows on street was not to noisy at all. and had nice view up and down street friendly staff great free coffee in lobby, great location short walk to metro stop.. gay bar downstairs but no noise .. liked it very much

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: GloucesterMonkey
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a fantastic location in the south of Boston within easy walking distance of both Copley Square and downtown Boston. The room was a reasonable size and clean. They were also fantastic at offering a late check out - 2pm on a Friday afternoon - much appreciated. Only negative comment is that the windows do not give much sound insultation and as the hotel is above a bar and on a busy bus route you should come prepared with ear plugs. By the way, you can get a great breakfast at the coffee shop around the corner. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “basic clean accommodation”
Reviews.Author: 19-DIARMUID_51
Reviews.Content: This is basic accommodation. Room is small, good location, clean (although sheets not changed in an 8 night stay). Friendly if slightly defensive staff. Note that this hotel is near the Mass, turnpike so you have traffic noise all night. There would not appear to be any quiet rooms (according to front desk). Great gay sports bar downstairs and dont miss Billy's Cafe round the corner for great lunch or breakfast. Nice staff and really cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: heatwell
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were worried about going to the hotel. We took a cab from logan to the hotel which took around 15mins. When we arrived we noticed the hotel was next to a bar, but we never heard any noise from the bar throughout the out week. Our room was nice, (nothing amazing) it was clean, comfy and had all what we needed. It had a TV which had loads of channels (although we hardley watched tv). The bathroom was small but really clean and everything worked. We had it cleaned daily with fresh towles. There was no tea and coffee in the room but there was a machine downstairs and you could have a bucket of ice in your room. The hotel was in a brill place, 5 min walk from back bay subway and if you get a good map you can walk to many attraction and malls. Lots of restaurants and starbucks and dunkin dougnuts around. The hotel were really informitive and called us taxi's often, they let us keep our luggage in the hotel after check out too as our floght was in the evening. Overall wewere really pleased and it was cheap too.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Ryno69
Reviews.Content: This hotel while quirky and cool, with friendly and knowledgeable staff, and having a great location to explore downtown Boston neighborhoods (Back Bay, South End, Beacon Hill, Downtown, etc.), also has small rooms and bathrooms, is a little more expensive than we'd hoped for (certainly given the size of the room), and has a horrible air-conditioning system. Our air conditioner (located in room 508) was a tiny window unit that blew light cool air inconsistently, would freeze up if left on high, and would also leak water after time no matter the setting. We stayed there 3 nights while on our honeymoon, and getting up in the middle of the night to adjust the air conditioner is decidedly un-romantic. Still, if you're looking for great location for the price (most hotels in Boston exceed $200/night, and this one was about $160), and like the "hominess" of its staff, this is good hotel. I'd give it a grade of a C+/B-. (Note to the staff: UPGRADE YOUR FRIGGIN' AIR-CONDITIONING UNITS PLEASE!).

Reviews.Title: “Chandler Inn is a dungeon!!”
Reviews.Author: jmonicac
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I were horrified by the conditions of the Chandler Inn. Trust me when I say that the photos online are VERY deceiving. Our room was extremely small, dark, dirty, and scary. In addition, there was an odd, musty odor that made my stomach turn when we walked in. I didn't think it could get worse, but the teeny tiny bathroom was disgusting and the toilet paper roll left on the dispenser was an old roll with like 2 squares left on it!!! We wanted to check out immediately but there were no other hotels available for the weekend so we suffered through the first two nights. We asked for an upgrade if available and the staff was less than friendly and not helpful. On top of all this, the cleaning staff threw away some of our clothes in a bag we left in the room and we barely received an apology for it. The ONLY thing that was positive about this place is that when we thankfully had an opportunity to switch hotels, they did not charge us for the nights we didn't stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Chandler was not what it advertised to be...”
Reviews.Author: slwickline
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Chandler because of their great website and claims of being a boutique hotel, unfortunately this was not the case. While there is a great little bar attached to the hotel the hotel itself was basically a 1 star at best. I have honestly stayed at nicer hostels with a bit better upkeep. My room smelled of old cigarettes and overall needed to be aired out for a few days. The bed had a rubber sheet over the mattress that squeaked every time you turned over and the bathroom was quite tiny, to the point of being uncomfortable. The positives were a pleasant staff, great water pressure and a lovely neighborhood with great restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Total misrepresentation on website”
Reviews.Author: NYPartyWiz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I searched for a hotel on Expedia for a 2 night stay in Boston and the Chandler Inn is located exactly where we wanted to be. Before booking on Expedia ($140 a night) I checked out the hotel's website and it looked like a completely different hotel. I assumed they went thru a renovation and that the photos on Expedia were old, so I went through with the reservation and requested a King bed. When we arrived, they had me sign in and on my reservation it was written in large letters "EXPEDIA". The elevator up to our room was done in all grey and opened up into a dingy stairwell from which you then enter a long hall to your hotel room. When we got into our room, Room 404, I was shocked by the size and look. It looked nothing like the rooms on the hotel's website. It was a creepy little room with stained carpet, very cheap furnishings, no luggage rack, no closet (just a tiny faux blonde wood laminated armoire), a polyester bedspread on a FULL-SIZE BED and a view of the office building directly across the street - out of one small window that was bolted shut and had an air conditioning unit that took up half the window. There was one outlet in the entire room and everything was plugged into it, so to charge a phone, we had to choose something to unplug. The light fixture in the ceiling gave off a depressing fluorescent hum and the bathroom was so tiny we couldn't put any of our toiletries in it, we had to keep them all on the only surface in the room - the small desk. The bathroom door had been painted so many times, that it didn't shut properly. We went downstairs and asked about another room as I had requested a King size bed, but was told they only had twins and queen-sized beds (ours was not a queen - but a Full...there is a significant difference). I suspected that they had "Expedia" rooms and that since we got a good price we were given this small, dingy room, but after reading other reviews, I guess they're all the same. I haven't stayed in such a depressing room since backpacking through Europe on a punishing budget. The only positive things were the location and the cleanliness of the room. One last note: it would be really nice if the older guys at the front desk were a little warmer; really, I mean, curt one-word answers don't cut it in customer service anymore. Just because people don't want to pay the truly outrageous hotel prices that seem to have become standard in the past few years, doesn't mean we deserve substandard customer service. Bottom line: I think we can all do much better than this hotel. At the very least, they should provide truthful representation on their website of the rooms they offer.

Reviews.Title: “The Chandler Inn: Great Location, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: sophia_m_m
Reviews.Content: The Chandler Inn is a nice hotel. It has a stylish lobby, with very nice staff who take care of you immediately. In addition, the staff are very helpful and knowledgable about the neighborhood and giving directions. In the lobby there is a great coffee/tea/hot chocolate machine. Next to this machine there are stairs but don't fear there are also two elevators. The room I stayed in, the standard twin, was a no frills room. It had everything it was supposed to have (which is listed on the website). The bathroom wasn't exquisite, but it was simple, like the room. My room had a window overlooking the street (beautiful!!). Furthermore, it is difficult to find such a bargain in such an upscale city. The simplicity and plainess of the Chandler Inn surprised me, and I enjoyed it. However, this may also repulse you. So it's not that the Chandler Inn is bad it is clean, safe, comfy. It's just a matter of perspective and preference. *Note: When you leave the hotel, you have to return the key to the receptionist. It sounds silly, but if you ask why they will willingly tell you (it is a very sound reason).

Reviews.Title: “The Chandler...a NIce little GEM!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler584
Reviews.Content: We've already stayed at one of Boston's pricier hotels. After searching through the internet, my husband found what seemed to be a nice place to accomodate our 3 night stay. Overall, the staff was attentive, our room SMALL(but clean and attended to daily...everything worked, by the way!), the neighborhood quaint and picturesque(great walking/running and so close to downtown...unbelievable!) There are nice restaurants and conveniences (though not FRILLY enough to pamper those with 'champagne and caviar' tastes) that dot the area. We're a FIT couple anyway so the hotel's proximity to what Boston has to offer was appreciated. We also appreciate a great value, good service and cleanliness. We're as fussy as anyone else, but we gave the Chandler Inn a chance and our experience there will hopefully be repeated next year. Yeah, it was good enough for us!

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot not to like”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay at the Chandler Inn. This time for 5 nights taking in a conference and some other business. I find it hard to understand the negative reviews this hotel gets. Sure, its a budget hotel - but you know that when you book it. With the Marriotts of the world @ circa $300 per night you are not going to get the Ritz for $150 per night in Boston. Regardless of what people have paid that is the 'going' rate. Don't use the hotels own site use one of the others - the rates are better. Yes the rooms are small and the bathroom smaller. I understand the guy who said the rooms remind him of his college dorm - but they are entirely adequate. The location is great (5 minutes to Backbay station or 10 minutes to Boyleston) with cafes around the corner, a CVS across the road and pizza and other food within a few minutes walk. The neighbour pleasant and non threatening and the hotel is clean. I've always found the staff pleasant and helpful. There appear to be some refurbished rooms (last time I stayed on the 8th floor in one) but I prefer the non-refurb room I stayed in the 1st time and this time as it has a desk. The free wifi works well but not, I guess, in all rooms as I've seen a few people sitting in the corridor with their laptops. Lets face it you are not going to stay here if you are on a corporate expense account. But as a budget choice in Boston I don't see much not to like. I'm back in Boston for another conference in June and have already booked my room.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Nicksahk
Reviews.Content: The prices here are out of date - I paid USD259 per night in April 2008. The rooms were small, no bath, no fridge and no aircon. There was also a large patch of water on the floor which the management were uninterested in fixing. Service standards from the staff were mixed -some were helpful, some not interested. Rooms were only cleaned in late afternoon, and then only after asking reception to send up a cleaner. The bar downstairs looks nice, but it is a gay bar so not suitable for families or couples. As it is non-smoking the customers tend to hang around outside the bar/hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a cost effective stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Londoner100
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very clean and a good size for the price ($150 per night). The room had a decent enough selection of TV channels and the free WIFI was great. The staff were really helpful and made us feel at home. This hotel does not have a restaurant but you can order in from a number of local restaurants for which the hotel provides a guide. The location was great as only a 5 min walk from Back Bay Metro station and a 10min walk from Copley Square, the nicest parts of Boston centre. The cab ride from Logan airport cost us $20. Best deals for the hotel are on online.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Jassym
Reviews.Content: For such a highly recommended hotel from the reviews, I was rather disappointed. Let's get the bad stuff out of the way. The counter people were not the friendliest people in America, I must say. They weren't rude or anything, just not very forthcoming with advise. There was no coffee maker in the room - you have to go to the lobby to use their coffee maker there. Although there was a fair selection of coffee to choose from, they taste really diluted. So much for a unglamorous trip downstairs in the PJs in the morning for a cuppa. And the room was tiny, the bathroom tinier. Two big men cannot possibly find the room comfortable. The closest starbuicks is a good 15 minutes walk away down Tremont Street. If there is a closer one, I didn't find it. But there is a nice cafe just round the corner. Not Fritz, that's another story. On the good side, free wireless! And the inn is rather close to Back Bay Station and the South End. You could also walk to Copley Mall and Prudential Centre in about half and hour.

Reviews.Title: “online photos from their website are totally bogus! Don't stay here....”
Reviews.Author: gaytravelhound
Reviews.Content: Nothing annoys me more in hotel websites than doctored photos...I'm just angry with myself that I didn't catch it myself...We stayed in a "deluxe" room based on their online photos...if this was deluxe, I'd hate to see standard... The room was a glorified closet, that looks like a bad wanna-be Starck designer threw up orange all over the place, including the bathroom amenities, that smelled like Tang... In the photos, the room has a spacious desk and chair...the actual room has a table that is used by the DVD player, and a chair in the corner...If you look carefully at the photo, you can see that it has been stretched to give the appearance that the room is considerably larger than it actually is.... The bathroom photo shows a huge walk in shower and bathroom...I've had larger bathrooms on cruise ships, though it was nice to be able to shower, shave and (well, you get the idea) all at the same time.... And the free breakfast? It was a $5 voucher at a local diner....the diner actually served great breakfast food...but it wasn't free.... All in all, the Chandler Inn is adequate for a Boston stay...but totally dishonest about what it actually is providing travelers...that's reason enough for me not to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grat price - Great location”
Reviews.Author: RockNY
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel while searching online and decided to give it a try based on the price and positive reviews.To start, the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was cute!, the room was simple and clean...... small, but had a very comfortable queen bed and the bathroom/shower was fine. Why spend another $100 a night to stay anywhere else???? I recommend this hotel and will return---- J.R -- Troy N.Y

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Chandler Inn-- Definately Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: NUIOrla
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chandler Inn for five nights in October '07 and it was just perfect. Friendly staff on arrival and a very clean, comfortable room awaited us. Housekeeping tended to the room everyday and the bathroom was extremely clean Yes, it is not 5 star but it is in a fabulous location and has a 7 / 11 store just round the corner, if you are stuck!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and small, but clean, comfortable, non-franchise charm”
Reviews.Author: bike5150
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Chandler last month. I wanted a clean, safe place to stay within walking distance of many local attractions, restaurants, etc., and I was more interested in seeing the city and spending my money on things other than a pricey hotel. The Chandler met my needs and expectations, and I would stay there again. As a single woman travelling alone, I felt very safe, both n the room and walking in the surrounding area. Contrary to some reviews I've read, it was VERY quiet. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was small, even tiny, and quite utilitarian, but that was okay with me. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Willow42
Reviews.Content: Although this isn't the most sumptuous hotel in Boston, its great value and in a great location. I would definitely recommend it and would be more than happy to stay there again. The staff were all friendly and the rooms, although basic, we're clean!

Reviews.Title: “Dormlike Room.”
Reviews.Author: rickeei
Reviews.Content: Oct 5th 2007. Well my wife and I booked this because they let us stay 1 night and that 's all we needed. But according to our timing with booking, it was the last room in Boston at 250.00. It is not worth 250.00 because there is no ammenities, but, it is very centrally located in Boston. It is definitely clean. But the decor has a little to desire. We have stayed in MANY places for less with more ammenities. Barely 10 tv channels. Full size bed. SMALL Room. Most powerful shower we've ever experienced. It was like getting powerwashed. Anyway it is centrally located , basically in the heart of Boston. Right next door there is a busy gay bar. But that's not our scene so we avoided it. We would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ag12346
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in Boston during a week that unfortunately coincided with the Harvard commencement, so rates at all the big chain hotels were through the roof! The accommodations were modest; my very small room contained two somewhat uncomfortable single beds, a loud window air conditioner, a high-pressure borderline painful shower head, a TV with a very limited channel selection, and generally out-of-date decor. The room was very clean, however, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. There was free (albeit slow) wi-fi. The inn has a relationship with a very nice local gym that will sell you a day pass for $10. Within a short walk were several nice places to eat, Boston Common, and the T. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for someone traveling on a budget and looking for adequate, practical lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: southiegirl33
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just recently stayed at the Chandler Inn. It is conveniently located in the heart of the Sound End of town and basically within walking distance of all major sites and attractions. Our room was very clean and our stay made much more enjoyable by Geraldo, Kevin, Gretchen and especially Nathan who was most accomodating. There was ALWAYS someone around when we had a question or needed a taxi. We will definatley return to this lovely inn. Sadie Newport, RI

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: AndesRuby
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had found a recommendation for the Chandler Inn in a book on Boston. We booked online and were largely pleased with the stay. If you're looking for something upscale and luxurious, the Chandler Inn is not your place. However, it's in a very nice, picturesque, and quite central location in the city. You may need to do around 10-15 minutes of (brisk) walking to get to Boston Common and other sites of interest, but at least you're already starting out in a good part of the city. The room itself was average. We were a little unsure of what to make of the burn marks in the comforter, but the sheets and carpet were clean, as well as the bathroom. Also, we had (over the air-conditioner) a rather nice view of the street below. Essentially, the hotel looks slightly run-down, but for how clean it is, outdated decor isn't a problem. Considering what a clean and centrally-located lodging it is, the price is a great deal! We had no problems with the staff either. All in all, I wouldn't mind staying at the Chandler Inn again, but when I visit the city of Boston next time, I may try to book a little farther in advance so I can get a reasonably-priced room at a step-up. If you find yourself in the same situation we were in when booking (doing it last-minute) and find your options limited, don't be afraid to go with the Chandler Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveBoston
Reviews.Content: I saw nothing at all seedy about his hotel. It is an old building but clean and well maintained. It is in a convenient, historic neighborhood of million dollar apartments right next to downtown. There is a wonderful cafe right around the corner. The room was freshly done over, and the bed was comfortable. The private bathroom was only big enough for one or perhaps two people, but that was fine. It's not a luxury hotel, but it's a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Average, ok location”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer81
Reviews.Content: The room was average, with a decently sized bed and a clean washroom. It is comparable to, e.g., a Travel Lodge or a Holiday Inn; there was nothing terribly special OR objectionable about the hotel because it had functional decor and decent service.

Reviews.Title: “Okay / more or less”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgent20
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is really good situated. You reach Boston downtown within 10 min. on foot. And public transportation is just around the corner. Staff was very friendly. The room had a good size but it had an offensive smell.... There is also a bar wich belongs to the Hotel, maybe interesting to mention that it is a gay-bar. But let me say, I've never seen some curious people in the hotel. Our room included Breakfast. I was a little bit surprised to get just ONE cupon for two persons about 5$ (not including the tax) so it was just impossible to get breakfast for two persons for this amount. Cupon was meant for a Restaurant just around the corner.... That's an absolute scream. Alltogether: It was okay for this stay. Next time I would search for another location to stay inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Option”
Reviews.Author: thegolfball
Reviews.Content: Not the Ritz, but the Chandler was a convenient, lower priced option for staying in beantown. The room was a bit dated, but comfortable. The staff was courteous. The internet worked. The bed clean and comfortable. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag and A Comedy of Internet Errors”
Reviews.Author: Beauty_on_the_Go
Reviews.Content: I was placed in this hotel by a travel agent. I had a nice room at first. Lots of windows and It had a great view of Boston. But. No internet access. They said the wireless should work, but I had to sit in the hall to get it to work. Then, I had to move to another room where the internet access also didn't work. I thought it was my computer-- but then I learned that every floor has a different hook up. Finally, I had to take a dark, smoking room-- which smelled like someone was still smoking inside-- just to get the internet. After the first room that was fairly distressing. Although, I will say that the staff more than bent over backwards to try and help me out. They were actually apologetic... and sincere. There are no irons or coffee pots in the rooms and they like you to leave your key when you leave to go out which is odd. But you do get a paper every morning and the location is good-- easily accessible to Newbury St., the Prudential Center and other places. There's a good coffee/ sandwich place around the corner, a 7-11 and a great drycleaner. That being said, the parking is horrendous. And having to park at a lot for about $17 a day is a huge pain. There are alot of parking restrictions in the area-- so reading the signs is a must unless you want to get hit with a pricey ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid except as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the staff fine, but other than that was terrible all around. Had the feel of a hostel more than a real hotel room. The bed - I could feel the springs digging into my back all night. Light - Dim and kept buzzing on and off. Carpeting - Cheap There is a bar downstairs and after last call at 2am the people spill out and start talking loudly. You can hear them clearly because the windows do not shut completely to accomodate the room air conditioner There is "wireless" but it runs so slow that i had 60 messages in my outbox even after i left it running all night. The neighborhood also doesn't feel too safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For The Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although not a 5 star hotel, is very much worth the money. It was clean, the staff was nice and the location was excellent. Just a short walk to the subway, next to the theatre district, 5-7 minutes from Newbury st. Yes the bathroom was small but for the price, you cannot complain. I would recommend this hotel to budget travellers and students.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: TracyB_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chandler hotel in early October. The room was a good size, the bathroom a little small but had a very good shower, both were clean. The staff were very helpful. It was about 10 mins walk to Newbury Street with all its shops. The only thing that might put me off going again was the bar downstairs. The Sunday night was very loud at kicking out time, about 2am. It might have been to do with it being Columbus Day the next day so there was no need to rush off home. Billy's diner a couple of doors away did a good cheap breakfast. Overall a good hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great staff , great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: sambennie
Reviews.Content: Spent the first 4 nights of our trip in this hotel and for the cash we paid it was great the location was great for the centre of town and for the 'T' stops. the staff were very friendly and gave us some good advice. The room we had was a corner room which has a much better view so try and request this. The bathroom is on the small side but your on holiday you don't spend 24 hrs in the loo !! It is a very mixed hotel i.e straight, gay, old, young but if you are prejudice then just don't book it and it might stop the bad review this place has gotten. The sheets were clean as were the towels the tea and coffee facilities were fine and the bed was comfy would stay again when visiting..great wee gem of place.

HotelInfo.Name: Chandler Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 26 Chandler Street, Boston, MA 02116
